description.S:
• Meet and assist upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport.
  • Transfer to the hotel for check-in.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• Morning tour of Old Delhi:
  • Drive past the historic Red Fort.
  • Visit Jama Masjid, India's largest mosque.
  • Enjoy a rickshaw ride through Chandni Chowk.
  • Visit Raj Ghat, the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi.
  • Afternoon tour of New Delhi:
  • Visit Qutub Minar and the Iron Pillar.
  • Explore Humayun's Tomb.
  • Drive past India Gate and Rashtrapati Bhavan.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After breakfast, drive to Mandawa.
  • Check-in at the hotel upon arrival.
  • Late afternoon visit the havelis around this area.
  • Overnight stay at Hotel.
  • Note: The small little beautiful town of Mandawa is in the heart of the Shekhawati region. Known for its wonderful castle and magnificent havelis, Mandawa gives the impression of living in the bygone era. Mandawa can be transcribed as a surprise at every turn. No single room either, in the havelis, is similar to that of the other. Most of the buildings are dated from the 18th century to early 20th century.

• After breakfast, drive to Bikaner.
  • On the way visit Fatehpur and see some wonderful Fresco examples here.
  • Arrive Bikaner.
  • Explore BIKANER – The royal fortified city with a timeless appeal.
  • Overnight stay at Hotel.
  • Bikaner: Lying in the north of the Desert State, the city is dotted with many sand dunes. Bikaner retains the medieval splendor that pervades the city’s lifestyle. More popularly called the camel country, the city is renowned for the best riding camels in the world. The ship of the desert is an inseparable part of life here. Be it pulling heavy carts, transporting grains or working on wells, camels are the prime helpers. The wells of Bikaner – an important source of water are other attractions of the city. These are built on high plinths with slender minaret towers on each of the four corners and can be noticed even from a distance.

• After breakfast, drive to Jaisalmer.
  • On arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • Explore JAISALMER – The royal fortified city with a timeless appeal.
  • Overnight stay at Jaisalmer.
  • Jaisalmer: Rising from the heart of the Thar Desert like a golden mirage is the city of Jaisalmer. A commanding fort etched in yellow sandstone stands, with its awesome splendor, dominating the amber-hued city. The city has an interesting legend associated with it, according to which, Lord Krishna, the head of the Yadav Clan, foretold Arjuna that a remote descendant of the Yadav Clan would build his kingdom atop the Trikuta Hill. His prophecy was fulfilled in 1156 AD when Rawal Jaisal, a descendant of the Yadav Clan and a Bhatti Rajput, abandoned his fort at Lodurva and founded a new capital—Jaisalmer, perched on the Trikuta Hill.

• After breakfast, proceed for a full-day sightseeing tour of The Golden City – Jaisalmer.
  • It is in the heart of the Great Indian Desert. Its temples, fort, and palaces are all built of yellow sandstone. The city is a mass of intricately carved buildings, facades, and elaborate balconies.
  • Visit the JAISALMER FORT – The oldest living fort in the world. (This is the highlight of the tour) See the Patwon-Ki-Havelis, Salim-Singh-Ki-Haveli, and Gandhi Sagar Tank.
  • In the afternoon, proceed to the SAM SAND DUNES to visit the typical Rajasthani Desert Village.
  • View the sunset from the dunes, as the sky is set on fire.
  • Return to the hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Breakfast at the hotel before departing for Jodhpur.
  • Drive to Jodhpur, an imperial city on the edge of the Thar Desert, rich in history and heritage.
  • Sightseeing in Jodhpur, once the capital of Marwar and home to the Rathors.
  • Visit Mehrangarh Fort, built on a hilly scarp, featuring palaces, miniature paintings, and a cradle room.
  • Explore Jaswant Thada Memorial, a stunning marble cenotaph.
  • Continue to Luni and check in at Fort Chanwa, an architectural masterpiece of red sandstone.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel in Luni.

• Drive to Udaipur with an en-route visit to Ranakpur Temples.
  • Explore 500-year-old temples, preserved in near-perfect condition.
  • Admire the intricate architecture of these extensive and complex temples.
  • Marvel at 1,444 uniquely carved pillars, where no two are alike.
  • The temple features 29 halls, 80 domes, and beautifully designed pavilions.
  • Stunning figures of dancing goddesses engraved on the pillars showcase architectural brilliance.
  • Continue the journey to Udaipur and stay overnight at a hotel.

• After breakfast, proceed for a sightseeing tour of Rajasthan’s beautiful lake cities.
  • Visit City Palace, featuring carved balconies, arches, and decorated pillars.
  • Explore Zanana Mahal, Durbar Hall, and Shambhu Niwas within the palace.
  • In the evening, enjoy a boat ride on Lake Pichola while witnessing a stunning sunset.
  • Admire the scenic surroundings of hills, palaces, temples, and bathing ghats.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: After breakfast, drive to Pushkar.
  • Pushkar Highlights:
  • Home to a semicircular lake with 52 ‘ghats.’
  • Maximum depth of the lake is 10 meters.
  • Considered the king of all ‘tiraths’ (pilgrimage sites).
  • Spiritual Significance:
  • A holy dip on Karthik Purnima is believed to wash away sins and grant salvation.
  • Bathing during the brighter fortnight of Karthik and seeing Varah (Vishnu’s incarnation) is said to prevent rebirth.
  • The Karthik Purnima dip equals the blessings of a hundred penances.
  • Mythological Importance:
  • Features numerous yojana spots, beyond the count of Brihaspati, the teacher of gods.
  • Evening: Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Drive to Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan.
  • Known as the Pink City, famous for forts, palaces, and lakes.
  • Rich in culture, history, and vibrant traditions.
  • Protected from the Thar Desert by the Aravalli Hills.
  • Overnight stay at a hotel.

• Excursion to Amber Fort, built under Raja Man Singh’s reign.
  • Enjoy an elephant ride up to the hilltop fort for a memorable experience.
  • Visit City Palace, a blend of Rajasthani & Mughal architecture.
  • Explore Chandra Palace, the seven-storied centerpiece with stunning city views.
  • Tour Jantar Mantar, a solar observatory with precise astronomical instruments.
  • See Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), a five-story pink sandstone structure from 1799.
  • Admire its 593 stone Jharokas, designed for royal women to observe the bustling streets unseen.

• Drive to Agra, visiting Fatehpur Sikri (Ghost Capital) en route.
  • Fatehpur Sikri was the political capital of the Mughal Empire under Akbar from 1571 to 1585.
  • The city was abandoned due to water scarcity.
  • Visit Emperor Akbar’s Residential Complex, Mosque & Tomb of Salim Chisti.
  • Continue the journey to Agra, located on the west bank of the Yamuna River.
  • Agra flourished as a center of Mughal architecture, art, and culture in the 16th century.
  • Home to iconic Mughal-era forts, buildings, and tombs.
  • Agra, known as ‘Agraban’ in the Mahabharata, is home to the Taj Mahal.
  • Check into the hotel upon arrival.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Early Morning Visit to Taj Mahal
  • Experience the sunrise at the iconic Monument of Love, the Taj Mahal.
  • Built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan as a tomb for his wife, Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Shah Jahan was later buried alongside her in the same tomb.
  • Constructed over 22 years with 20,000 workers.
  • White marble sourced from Makrana, Rajasthan.
  • Features intricate inlay work with precious and semi-precious stones, showcasing Mughal architectural brilliance.
  • Return to the hotel for breakfast.
  • Visit to Mughal Emperor Akbar’s Tomb, Sikandra
  • Located 3 km from Agra city.
  • Akbar started its construction, later completed by his son Jehangir.
  • The tomb features Indo-Saracenic architecture, resembling the Taj Mahal.
  • Exploring Itmad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb
  • Built in Charbagh architectural style.
  • Designed by Itmad-Ud-Daulah himself.
  • Features intricate inlay work with unique patterns, including a wine flask with snake-shaped handles.
  • Houses tombs of other family members.
  • Visit to Agra Fort
  • Explore the grand Mughal fort with stunning architecture and rich history.
  • Drive Back to Delhi
  • Transfer to the airport for onward destination.

name.S: Arrival NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport – Gangtok

description.S:
• Arrive at NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport (IXB) at 500 ft/150 m elevation.
  • Our office executive will greet you and assist with boarding your vehicle.
  • Travel to Gangtok (5500 ft/1677 m; 130 km; approx. 4 hrs).
  • Check in and stay overnight at the hotel.

• Morning Departure: After breakfast, head out for an excursion.
  • Destination: Visit Tshangu Lake, located 43 km away with a 3-hour journey one way.
  • Altitude & Depth: The lake sits at 12,400 ft (3,780 m) with an average depth of 50 ft.
  • Experience: Enjoy the cool waters and surrounding scenic beauty.
  • Return: Head back to Gangtok and spend the night at a hotel.

• Half-day sightseeing: choose between Rumtek Monastery or Jhakri Water Falls
  • Visit Droul Chorthen, Research Institute of Tibetology, Directorate of Handicraft & Handloom, and Enchey Monastery
  • Afternoon transfer to Kalimpong (3937 ft/1200 m, 85 km/3 hrs)
  • Check-in and overnight hotel stay

• After breakfast, visit Dello Hills, Dr. Graham’s Home, Flower Nurseries, Jang-Dong-Palriffo Brang & Durbin Dara Hills.
  • Transfer to Darjeeling (7380 ft / 2250 m, 70 kms / 03 hrs).
  • Overnight at hotel.

• Depart early (around 4 AM) to Tiger Hills (8364 ft / 2550 m) for a sunrise view over Kanchendzonga Peak (weather permitting).
  • Return via Ghoom Monastery and Batasia Loop.
  • After breakfast, enjoy a half-day sightseeing tour including:
  • Japanese Temple & Peace Pagoda
  • Padmaja Naidu Himalayan Zoological Park & Himalayan Mountaineering Institute (closed on Thursday)
  • Tenzing & Gombu Rock
  • Tibetan Refugee Self-Help Center (closed on Sunday)
  • Tea Estate OR visit Rock Garden & Ganga Maya Lake.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Enjoy your breakfast.
  • Depart for NJP Railway Station or (IXB) Bagdogra Airport.
  • The journey covers 100 Kms in approximately 03 hrs.
  • Proceed for your onward connection or journey.

name.S: Arrival NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport – Darjeeling

description.S:
• Upon arrival at NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport (IXB), our office executive will meet you at the station or airport.
  • Assist you in boarding your vehicle to Darjeeling.
  • The journey to Darjeeling (7,380 ft / 2,250 m) covers approximately 72 km and takes about 1 hour and 32 minutes.
  • Overnight accommodation will be provided at the hotel.

• Early Morning at 4:00 AM Depart for Tiger Hill (8,364 ft / 2,550 m) to witness the sunrise over Kanchenjunga Peak (weather permitting).
  • Morning:
  • Visit Ghoom Monastery.
  • Explore Batasia Loop.
  • Post-Breakfast:
  • Visit Japanese Temple and Peace Pagoda.
  • Explore Padmaja Naidu Himalayan Zoological Park and Himalayan Mountaineering Institute (closed on Thursdays).
  • Visit Tenzing & Gombu Rock.
  • Explore Tibetan Refugee Self-Help Center (closed on Sundays).
  • Tour a Tea Estate or visit Rock Garden & Ganga Maya Lake.
  • Evening:
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: After breakfast, depart for Mirik (approximately 50 km, 2 hours).
  • Midday: Visit Pashupati Nagar Market, located at the Indo-Nepal border, known for affordable imported goods like electronics, clothing, and perfumes.
  • Afternoon: Explore Mirik Lake; enjoy horse riding and boating (available for an additional fee).
  • Evening: Return to Darjeeling for overnight stay.

Overview: Embark on an unforgettable journey with Eaze Tours’ North East Tour to Darjeeling, India. Your adventure begins at NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport, where you’re warmly greeted and transferred to the charming hill station of Darjeeling. Experience the magic of a pre-dawn visit to Tiger Hills, witnessing a breathtaking sunrise over the majestic Kanchendzonga Peak. A delightful excursion to Mirik, including a visit to the Indo-Nepal border at Pashupati Nagar, adds further charm to this well-crafted itinerary.

description.S:
• Arrive in Manali and check into your accommodation.
  • Spend the day acclimatizing to the altitude.
  • Meet your guide, review the itinerary, and prepare your gear for the adventure.
  • Afternoon explore Manali by testing biking visit Naggar Castle, Jagatsukh Temple and Vashist Hot Spring etc.
  • Overnight at hotel (B).

• After breakfast full day biking tour in around Manali includes Manikaran, Hadimba Temple and Kullu Valley.
  • Overnight stay at hotel (B).

• After breakfast commence biking tour to Leh via Rohatang Pass (3990M).
  • Enjoy the biking via Gulaba,Marchi, Rani Nala, Rohatang Jyot, Koksar, Gondal, Tandi (Confluence of Chandra and Bhaga River), Keylong finally reach at Jispa.
  • Arrival check in hotel or fix tent (B/D).

name.S: Jispa – Darcha- Suraj Tal- Baralachal Pass (4890m) – Sarchu (110 Km)

description.S:
• Breakfast at hotel or fix tent.
  • Prepare your bike to cover next destination, through the high passes and nice landscape, cross small hamlets or tea stall as Darcha, this is the first TRC checking points and this place is known for adventure lover who want commence trek to Zanskar Valley.
  • Ascend to Baralacha La Pass (4,890 meters), known for its mesmerizing landscapes.
  • On arrival at Sarchu take the tent for overnight stay. (B/D)

• After breakfast get ready to next day biking tour to Tsokar (Salt) Lake, enjoy the landscape and time to time break for photos, on arrival at Tsokar check in fix tent, rest of the time explore surrounding, catch the wild animals (Hinting with Camera).
  • Overnight enjoy the meal. (B/D)

• After breakfast at fix tent proceed to Tsomoriri via Sumdah Village, again magnificent rIde see the wild animals, landscape and sulpher water spring.
  • En route visit the Tibetan refugee village.
  • Cross the Namshang La 4920m.
  • & a small lake Thachung Karo Lake.
  • Continue drive to Karzok (Tsomoriri) check in fix tent, rest of the time visit crystal Water Lake walking tour is possible there, bikes not allowed.
  • Overnight at Tsomoriri. (B/D)

name.S: Tsomoriri – Mahay BrIdge- Chumathang – Leh (145 Km)

description.S:
• After breakfast start your rIde going through the Indus River many crossing many small villages and hamlets , Reach Natural Hot Spring at Chumathang.
  • Visit hot spring and lunch.
  • After that continue drive to Leh, through the small village, markets along with the India River, en route visit Hemis Monastery.
  • On arrival at Leh check in hotel.
  • Rest of the time free. (B/D)

name.S: Nubra Valley Over Khardung La Pass (120 Km)

description.S:
• After breakfast start rIding to Nubra over the Khardong La Pass (5602m) – the Highest Motorable Road in the World.
  • You will stop on the top of the pass when one can see the Snow Peak Mountains and glacier.
  • Have a cup of Hot Tea from the Highest Cafeteria in the World.
  • This is an old route which used as part of the Legendary Silk Road which ran to Tibet, China & Turkmenistan, behind the Khardong mountain pass.
  • The Road opens up and you are met with the wonderful view of the fruitful green valley of Ladakh which are watered thanks to Shyok and Nubra waterways-this road was previously on the silk street and lots of Caravans weaved their way further to central Asia- the green Nubra valley was for centuries the resting spot for Camel and Yak caravans- you will see apple, apricot and lots of mulberry trees in Hunder and other areas, Lamaism plays an important role in life in this area.
  • After that continue drive through Nubra valley to Diskit, total drive will takes about 4 hrs.
  • Upon reaching check in Guest House.
  • Late afternoon, optional, You can also enjoy the Bactrian (Double hump) camel in the sand dune between Hunder and Diskit Village.
  • Overnight at Diskit. (B/D)

• After breakfast visit Diskit Monastery, The Diskit monastery was founded by Changzem Tserab Zangpo in the 14th century.
  • The history of the Nubra Valley and the monastery could thus be traced from 14th century onwards.
  • It has a tallest statue of Maitreya Buddha in Ladakh.
  • After that visit Sumoor village and drive back to Leh.
  • Upon arrival check in hotel.
  • Late afternoon visit Shanti Stupa for Sunset Tour.
  • The Stupa is located on the hill top of the Changspa locality in Leh, it was built in 1983 on the rock and inaugurated by HH Dalai Lam.
  • From this Stupa you can see the memorable sunset over the Leh Valley.
  • After that back to Leh and some free time for shopping.
  • Evening dinner. (B/D)

• After breakfast full day rIding to lower Ladakh called Sham Valley, straight drive to Lamayuru, visit monastery and moon land, drive back to Leh, en route visit Rizong Gompa, Alchi Choskor, Likir, Basgo Palace and Nimmo (Confluence of Indus and Zanskar River) if the time is allowed just a photo break at Gurudwara Pathar Saheb.
  • Rest of the time free at Leh market. (B/D)

• Full day free for individual activities or last time shopping etc.
  • Celebrate your achievement with your team.
  • Overnight at hotel (B/D)

• Bid farewell to the Himalayas.
  • Early in the morning departure transfer to airport connect flight to Delhi or onward destination.

Description: Embark on an epic Manali–Keylong–Jispa-Darcha-Suraj Tal-Baralachal Pass adventure to Leh, Nubra Valley, and more with Eaze Tours packages. Book Now!

  • Check-in and checkout set at 12:00 PM
  • Daily breakfast and dinner provided
  • Professional biking guides and support staff

Overview: Experience the thrill of cycling through the majestic Himalayas with our Manali to Leh Mountain Bike Tour. This journey takes you across rugged terrains, lush valleys, and some of the world’s highest motorable passes. Designed for adventure enthusiasts, this tour offers breathtaking views, cultural encounters, and the satisfaction of conquering challenging routes.

description.S:
• Arrival at Leh airport meet to our representative and transfer to hotel, during the check in time you will get tea, coffee, snacks, etc.
  • Complete the check formalities.
  • After lunch commence walking tour in the market or visit Shanti Stupa, Tsomo Castle.
  • Overnight at hotel. (B/D)

• After breakfast full day sightseeing of Lamayuru, Rizong, Alchi, Gurudwara Pathar Saheb, Nimmo (Confluence of Indus and Zanskar River).
  • Drive back to Leh, rest of the time free for indivIdual activities.
  • Overnight at hotel (B/D)

name.S: Leh – Spituk (Kali Temple) – Zinchen: 4-5 H. Trek

description.S:
• After the breakfast drive to Spituk BrIdge behind the Spituk monastery, around 7 kms from Leh town.
  • From Spituk brIdge starts the trekking along Indus River walking through flat and desolate plane at the foot of the Stok Mountain.
  • Ascend to higher altitudes, crossing breathtaking mountain passes.
  • Soon you arrive at Zingchen through a gorge, which gives you a feeling of complete isolation.
  • Stay overnight in Camp at Zingchen. (B/D)

• Leave Zingchen for Rumbak through a straight forward road; leaving village, you enter Hemis national park for the preservation of Snow leopard, Baharal, marmot, wolf etc.
  • Walk through a narrow trail and valley wIdens as you arrive Rumbak and camp at Yurutse below Gandala Pass.
  • Overnight in Camp. (B/D)

name.S: Yurutse – Gondala (4350m) – Shingo – Skyu: 7 – 8 H. Trek

description.S:
• From Yurutse follow the path along the mountain sIde, then cross a small valley and follow zig zag steep path.
  • There after cross Gandala pass (4380m).
  • Then walk the long descent towards Shingo for 2 hrs that will lead to the valley of Markha and after few hundred meters you reach Skyu.
  • Overnight halt in tents. (B/D)

• After breakfast commence trek to Markha village, follow a good path on the right bank of Markha where one can find great vegetation.
  • Then cross the right bank of river then the barren plain and arrive at Chaluk.
  • Thereafter, walk along the left bank of river and after another crossing climb towards Markha village.
  • Towards the end of the village there are good camp site near the river.
  • Overnight stay in tents. (B/D)

name.S: Markha Village – Hankar – Thachunche: 7-8 H. Trek

description.S:
• Right after breakfast you start trekking in the morning to reach Tchatchutse via Hankar village.
  • Overnight in tents. (B/D)

• After breakfast start trekking to reach Nimaling.
  • Nimaling (4900 M) has a sweeping pasture where thousands of sheep, goats and yaks graze during the summer months.
  • Rising to the south is 6400 M high Kang Yatse (Nimaling Peak), a lovely mountain, but not an easy one to climb.
  • Overnight in tents. (B/D)

• After breakfast start trekking to reach Kongmaru La (5100 M).
  • The trek to Kongmaru la passes through narrow gorges.
  • From the top of the pass, you can have a view of Ladakh ranges and the sight of villages to the north of Indus valley is excellent.
  • Cross the pass and proceed to Shang.
  • Overnight in tents. (B/D)

name.S: Shang Sumdo Village – Hemis – Leh: 2 H. Trek /Drive

description.S:
• Walk along the stream down to Hemis monastery, which is one of the oldest and richest monasteries in Ladakh.
  • Visit Hemis monastery and drive to Leh, enroute visit Thiksey Monastery, Shey Palace and Stok Palace cum museum.
  • On arrival at Leh check in hotel, rest of the time free for indivIdual activities. (B/D)
• After breakfast in time depart from the base location, taking with you unforgettable memories departure transfer to airport, board onward flight and a sense of accomplishment.

Name: Markha Trek
LocationDescription: Leh – Spituk (Kali Temple) - Zinchen-Yurutse – Gondala– Shingo – Skyu-Markha Village – Hankar – Thachunche-Nimaling – Shang Sumdo-Hemis – Leh
Title: Trekking Tour in India: Markha Trek Adventure - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore the thrilling Markha trek from Leh to Hemis via Spituk, Zinchen, Nimaling, and Shang Sumdo. Experience India's scenic trekking routes with Eaze Tours.
Additional_Information:
• Difficulty Level: Varies from easy to challenging trails, suitable for beginners and experienced trekkers
  • Best Time to Visit: October to March for most regions; May to September for Himalayan treks
  • What to Bring: Comfortable trekking shoes, warm clothing, a backpack, water bottle, and personal essentials

Overview: Discover the untouched beauty of India’s mountains, forests, and valleys with our Trekking Tour in India. Perfect for nature lovers and adventure seekers, this tour takes you through picturesque trails, rich cultural heritage, and diverse landscapes. Whether it’s the Himalayan foothills, Western Ghats, or the serene deserts of Rajasthan, this trekking journey is a blend of adventure and tranquility.

description.S:
• Arrive breakfast tour briefing by Local Staff, followed by half day visit of the “City of Joy ” also the Mother Teresa’s city.
  • Palaces to visit are the Jain Temple , Zoological Gardens, Victoria Memorial & drive past Howrah BrIdge , Dalhousie Square , Fort Williams , Secretariat Building and Old Court House Street.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• After breakfast, provide in-time departure & transfer to airport to connect the flight for Bagdogra.
  • On arrival at Bagdogra airport followed by drive to Darjeeling (68 kms by Road takes around 3 hrs).
  • Darjeeling is one of the most beautiful Hill Stations in Eastern India and has the highest Race Course in the World.
  • Place worth visiting are the Lablong village, the Mountaineering Institute and Tenzing Norgay House – The first Everest Hero.
  • On arrival Check into the Hotel.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• Early morning tour of Tiger Hill & Ghoom Monastery.
  • At the Tiger Hill, the early morning Sun rise displays a panorama of colours and sunsets are purple and gold.
  • Beyond in the distance are the Himalayan Peaks.
  • Return via the famous Ghoom Monastery.
  • Spend the rest of the day walking in the markets of Darjeeling or visiting one of the Tea gardens (Darjeeling tea is known world over for its fine flavor).
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• After breakfast drive to Pemayangste.
  • Afternoon visit the Monastery (Pemayangste is situated in Pelling, West Sikkim).
  • It is perched at a height of 2085 meters and is the second oldest and perhaps the most important monastery in Sikkim.
  • This monastery belongs to the Nyingma order & all their Nyingma order monasteries in Sikkim are subordinate to it.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• After breakfast drive to Gangtok.
  • The capital of Sikkim and a city of great scenic beauty, is surrounded by green forests.
  • On arrival Check into the Hotel.
  • Rest of the day at leisure.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• After breakfast city tour Gangtok.
  • There are a number of monasteries in and around Sikkim, each a symbol of Himalayan Buddhism.
  • Afternoon free.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• Morning visit Enchey Monastery, The ResIdency – for an excellent view of the mountains, the White Memorial Hall, Institute of Tibetology and Deer Park.
  • Continue to visit the famous Rumtek Monastery belonging to the RED HAT sect of Tibetan Buddhism.
  • Afternoon free.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• In time drive to Bagdogra airport to connect the flight for Calcutta.
  • On arrival at Calcutta airport, transfer to hotel.
  • Rest of the day at leisure.
  • Overnight at Hotel.

• After breakfast day free.
  • Provide in-time departure & transfer to airport to connect the flight for onward journey.

description.S:
• Drive the taxi to Manali, passing through an important junction on the salt route to Tibet.
  • Mandi is the gateway to the Kullu valley. Moving via Mandi, tourists will see the impressive Pandoh Dam that diverts water from the Beas River through two 12 km tunnels to Baggi. The beautiful view of the mountains can be enjoyed while moving through the Sainj valley.
  • On the way to Manali, there are interesting sights along both sides of the 42 km valley, such as the Vaishno Devi Temple – a small cave temple dedicated to Vaishno Devi.
  • Other interesting places to explore include Katrain, Patlikuhl, Nagar, and Roerich Gallery.

• Drive the taxi toward Leh, after the local sightseeing of Manali.
  • At the northern end of the Kullu Valley lies the main resort in the area. It is beautifully situated, offering many pleasant walks around the town, along with a large number of hotels and restaurants.
  • Attractions of local sightseeing.

• The tough journey will begin toward Leh, with Darcha being the major tent site on this road.
  • The next move is to Baralachala, which stands at 4883 meters, known as the crossroads pass.
  • After this pass, tourists enter another tent site called Sarchu.
  • The journey becomes more adventurous and interesting while passing Lachlung La (5060 meters), the second highest pass on the Manali-Leh road.
  • The next destination is Pang, just after tourists pass Taglang La, the second highest motorable road in the world, at 5328 meters.
  • On the descent, tourists enter the Ladakh region, and the first village is Upshi, where one can enjoy the beautiful landscape and magnificent valley views.

name.S: Hemis to Pangong Lake / Tso Moriri Lake

description.S:
• In the morning, visit the Hemis monastery (Travelers have the option to visit either of the Lakes).
  • Hemis Monastery: This is the biggest and most important monastery in Ladakh (It’s situated 49 kms to the south of Leh), a little off the main Leh-Manali road. It was built in the 17th century by Chapgon Gyalshas and has enjoyed the patronage of the royal family ever since.
  • Hemis is the headquarters of the Drukpa order, and all the monasteries throughout Ladakh are administered by it. It also trains Lamas for the royal monasteries at Leh, Shey, and Bazgo.
  • In the 19th century, it faced a siege by General Zorawar Singh. The Gompa was saved due to the skillful handling of the situation by the head Lama.

name.S: Pangong Lake / Tso Moriri Lake to Leh

description.S:
• On the way back, sightseeing of Thiksey and Shey palace.
  • On Day 7, complete rest in the hotel in Leh.

• Explore Leh Market, Leh Palace, and Sankar Gompa.
  • The women’s vegetable market in the afternoon and some interesting places to visit.
  • And in the evening, The Sankar monastery.

• The tourists will visit the Khardung-la. It takes you to the highest motorable road in the world, Khardungla (18,380 feet or 5,578 m).
  • Nubra Valley lies in the north of Leh. Apart from unparalleled trekking opportunities, the valley has several Buddhist monasteries such as Sumor, Tigar, and the 350 years old Diskit monastery.

• On the 10th day, the whole day is dedicated to shopping and exploring interesting things about Ladakhi art and culture by visiting the Tibetan refugees camp in Choklamsar, the Library, and Ecological Development, etc.

• Local sightseeing Leh to Lamayuru, Likir & Alchi and halt for the night at Lamayuru.
  • Whole day is dedicated to local sightseeing.
• On Day 12, the caravan moves towards Kargil, passing through the following places:
• Drive the taxi toward Srinagar, passing through Zoji-la and picturesque Sonamarg, entering the Kashmir Valley.

• Dal Lake: Much of Dal Lake is a maze of intricate waterways rather than a simple body of open water. The lake is divided into Gagribal, Lokut Dal, and Bod Dal by a series of causeways. Dal Gate, at the city end of the lake, controls the flow of the lake water into the Jhelum River canal.

• Enjoy a leisurely morning in Srinagar
  • Transfer to Srinagar Airport for a flight to Delhi
  • Arrive in Delhi and proceed with your onward journey

description.S: • Explore iconic attractions like India Gate and Qutub Minar.

• Provide in-time departure & transfer to airport to connect the flight for Leh.
  • After a breathtaking flight over the trans Himalayas and breathtaking landing, you will be welcomed and escorted to our hotel.
  • A little briefing on the days program and a breakfast.
  • You are advised to rest for the first half of the day. After lunch, we will explore Leh market.
  • Overnight in the hotel.

• After breakfast, we will visit the Spituk monastery. Enjoy your first encounter with the beautiful Buddhist monastery and understand 'the Buddhist life'. Buddhism in this part of the world is also part of the social life. We live religion in this part of the world.
  • Also visit the 'Much famed Kali Temple' also known as the Temple of Palden Lhamo (by Buddhist). You will see Buddhist as well Hindus (Indian army) worshipping there.
  • Return to hotel for lunch. Post lunch we will visit the market and Shanti Stupa (Japanese peace Pagoda) on the nearby Hillock of Leh town (visit Shanti stupa at sunset).
  • Enjoy the scintillating view of the Leh town, upper Leh towards Khardung La and the part of upper Indus valley.
  • Light at sunset or sunrise is just perfect for perfect pictures with the Himalayan mountain ranges at the background.
  • Evening dinner at hotel.

• After breakfast, we depart to Lamayuru, enroute visits Liker Monastery and Gurudwara Pathar Sahib.
  • Check in Camp at Alchi or Ule and enjoy your hot lunch.
  • After Lunch drive to visit the mesmerizing Moon landscapes and the Lamayuru monastery (Oldest Monastery in Ladakh).
  • Overnight Camp or Hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Leh en-route visit Alchi Monastery, Basgo Palace and Hall of Fame.
  • Arrive at Leh by afternoon, having hot and yummy lunch at Hotel.
  • After the free at your leisure. Overnight stay at hotel.

• After Breakfast drive to Nubra Valley via Khardungla (highest motorable road in the World, 18,380 feet).
  • Arrive at Diskit by Afternoon. Rest of the day free to explore Diskit, Hunder Villages.
  • Overnight Hotel.

• After Breakfast visit Diskit Monastery and drive back to Leh by same Route, crossing Khardung La Pass.
  • Overnight stay at Hotel.

• After Breakfast leave for Pangong Lake (14,500 feet), through Changla Pass (17,350 feet). It’s the 3rd highest motorable road in the World.
  • Overnight Camp.

• After Breakfast drive back to Leh, enroute visit Hemis, Thikse Monastery, and Shey Palace.
  • Overnight stay at Hotel.

• Provide in-time departure & transfer to airport to connect the flight for Delhi.
  • Flight back to Delhi with unforgettable memories.
  • On arrival at Delhi airport, transfer to hotel.
  • Overnight at hotel.

• After Breakfast day free.
  • In-time departure & transfer to airport to connect the flight for onward journey to your Home.

name.S: Ayurveda – A Balance of Body, Mind, and Soul

description.S: Kerala is the only state in India that practices Ayurveda with true dedication. Ayurveda focuses not just on treating the affected area, but on healing the individual as a whole. This holistic approach is the perfect way to rejuvenate yourself, eliminate toxins, and restore balance and health to your body.

Kerala's unique climate, lush forests, and the cool monsoon season create an ideal environment for Ayurvedic healing. With temperatures consistently between 24-28°C, Kerala enjoys a mild climate, especially during continuous rains. The high humidity levels enhance the effectiveness of natural medicines, allowing them to work at their peak potency. We have partnered with several Ayurvedic hospitals and resorts in Kerala to offer traditional treatment packages for rejuvenation and stress management, ranging from 3 to 21 days.

Kerala offers world-class dental care with highly skilled dentists and advanced treatment technologies, all at a fraction of the cost due to the region’s lower cost of living. Dental clinics in Kerala provide a wide range of services such as root canal therapy, dentures, crowns, dental implants, porcelain crowns, dental surgery, teeth whitening, cosmetic dentistry, and braces at affordable rates. We offer exceptional dental treatment packages combined with a relaxing vacation in Kerala.

Ayurveda will revitalize your body, mind, and soul. We've partnered with Ayurvedic hospitals and resorts in Kerala that specialize in traditional Ayurvedic treatments. Special therapy packages are available for rejuvenation and stress management, with options ranging from 3 to 21 days, including daily yoga and meditation. Packages include all meals and accommodation in deluxe cottages.

Abhyangam, or oil massage, involves the application of medicated oils all over the body. This specialized massage is tailored to address specific conditions and is performed for 45 minutes daily. It is particularly beneficial for rheumatism, diabetic gangrene (poor blood circulation in the extremities), and similar conditions.

Ilakkizhi (also called Patrasweda) is a medication that uses bundles of herbal leaves mixed with grated coconut and mustard. The bundles are used to massage and apply heat to the body after oil application. This treatment provides relief from rheumatic pains and swelling in the joints.

Podikkizhi is a therapeutic sweating method where linen bags filled with powdered herbal drugs are used to massage and foment the body. It is highly effective for conditions caused by imbalances in the Vata and Kapha doshas.

Panchakarma is an Ayurvedic detoxification therapy designed to eliminate accumulated toxins and restore vitality. This process involves five treatments: Vamana (emesis), Virechana (purging), Snehavasti (medicated oil enema), Kashayavasti (medicated decoction enema), and Nasya (medication through the nostrils). After Panchakarma, adopting a healthy lifestyle helps maintain optimal well-being.

This combined treatment includes the traditional Abhyangam massage along with a special Ayurvedic facial massage. The facial massage revitalizes the skin, making it healthy and glowing, while helping you relax and release daily tensions. Using herbal extracts and essential oils, this treatment applies pressure to specific points, as well as rhythmic strokes for contouring.

Udvarthanam is a unique Ayurvedic treatment where a special herbal powder is massaged into the body in an upward motion. This treatment is part of our slimming program and is particularly effective for reducing excess fat and addressing obesity.

Navarakkizhi involves massaging the body with small linen bags filled with Navara rice, after the application of medicated oils. This treatment benefits those with muscle atrophy, arthritis, muscle weakness, tremors, and fibromyalgia. It has anti-aging properties and helps rejuvenate the body.

Ksheeradhara involves the gentle pouring of medicated milk, usually mixed with herbal decoctions, over the body. When applied to the head, it is called Shirodhara. For the entire body, it is known as Sarvangadhara. This treatment is beneficial for disorders caused by imbalances in the Pitta dosha.

Thakradhara is a highly relaxing therapy for the mind and body. It is commonly used to treat conditions like Alzheimer's disease, insomnia, stress, hypertension, and skin disorders such as psoriasis. This treatment involves pouring buttermilk, which has cooling properties, over the forehead. It relaxes the mind, reduces stress, and improves memory.

Pizhichil is a therapy where lukewarm medicated oil is poured over the body while the patient lies on a special platform. The oil-soaked clothes are squeezed and rubbed over the body. Pizhichil is recommended for conditions related to the Vata dosha, such as hemiplegia (paralysis), muscle spasms, and other degenerative diseases affecting the muscles.

description.S:
• Arrive in Chennai, the gateway to southern India, where you will be greeted with a traditional welcome.
  • Afterward, transfer to your hotel for an overnight stay. Established in 1639 by the East India Company, Chennai is one of India’s oldest cities.

name.S: Chennai Sightseeing and Transfer to Mahabalipuram

description.S:
• After breakfast, meet our tour executive who will brief you about your journey and hand over your travel documents. Later, enjoy a half-day sightseeing tour of Chennai, passing landmarks such as Anna Salai, Marina Beach, Gandhi Memorial, Kala Kshetra, Mylapore Temple, and Kapaleeshwarar Temple. After the tour, drive to Mahabalipuram.
  • On arrival, check in to your hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, take a day trip to Kanchipuram, the ancient capital of the Pallava dynasty, known as the 'City of a Thousand Temples.' Visit the temples of Ekambaswara, Kailasanatha, Sri Kamakshi, and Varadarajaswamy. Kanchipuram is also famous for its silks.
  • Later, return to Mahabalipuram for a half-day city tour. This ancient port, built in the 7th century, is renowned for its sculptural marvels. Visit the Shore Temple, which houses both Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu.
  • Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, check out and drive to Pondicherry. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy a half-day city tour. Visit the Aurobindo Ashram, located 10 km north of Pondicherry, which promotes a fusion of Yoga and modern science. After lunch, visit Auroville, an international community that promotes harmonious living.
  • Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, drive to Chidambaram to visit the famous Nataraja Temple, known for its golden-plated sanctum and depiction of Lord Shiva as a cosmic dancer. Afterward, continue to Thanjavur.
  • On arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, enjoy a city tour of Thanjavur, the former capital of the Chola dynasty.
  • Visit the Brihadeeswarar Temple, also known as the 'Big Temple,' which boasts a tower that rises 66 meters. In the afternoon, explore the local markets at your leisure.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Trichy (Tiruchirapalli), a city steeped in history and tradition. Visit the Rock Fort Temple, perched 23 meters high, and the Srirangam Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Continue your journey to Chettinad, famous for its grand mansions and rich cultural heritage.
  • Visit the Chettinad Museum, which showcases traditional artifacts.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Madurai, one of the oldest cities in southern India. Known as the 'Athens of the East,' Madurai has a history dating back 2,500 years.
  • On arrival, check into your hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, visit the renowned Meenakshi Temple, a prime example of Dravidian architecture.
  • Later, explore the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, known for its stunning stucco work on the domes and arches. Relax in the evening and enjoy an overnight stay at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Periyar Tiger Reserve, a renowned wildlife sanctuary in the Western Ghats. The reserve is home to a variety of wildlife, including elephants, tigers, and several species of birds. Enjoy a serene boat ride on the Periyar Lake to spot wildlife.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel and spend the rest of the day exploring the local markets.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, explore the wildlife sanctuary. Enjoy a boat ride on Periyar Lake and keep an eye out for elephants, deer, and various bird species.
  • Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

name.S: Periyar to Kumarakom and Houseboat Cruise

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Kumarakom and board a traditional houseboat for a backwaters cruise. Kerala’s backwaters are a network of serene lakes, canals, and estuaries that offer a glimpse into the local way of life. During the cruise, visit nearby villages, coir-making factories, paddy fields, and temples. The boat will anchor at a peaceful spot for the night.
  • Overnight on the houseboat.

• After breakfast, continue your backwaters cruise and later drive to Cochin. On arrival, check into your hotel and embark on a city tour. Visit St. Francis Church, the oldest European church in India, the famous Chinese Fishing Nets, and Mattancherry Palace, renowned for its mural paintings. In the evening, enjoy a Kathakali dance performance.
  • Overnight at your hotel.
• After a leisurely breakfast, spend the day at your own leisure until it's time for your transfer to Cochin Airport for your onward journey.

Overview: Experience the vibrant charm of South India with our Chennai to Cochin Tour Package. This journey takes you through the cultural heartlands of Tamil Nadu and Kerala, showcasing ancient temples, stunning beaches, lush backwaters, and rich traditions. From Chennai's colonial elegance to Cochin's historic allure, this tour offers a perfect blend of heritage, nature, and relaxation.

description.S:
• Arrive in Cochin, where you will be greeted with a traditional welcome.
  • Afterward, transfer to your hotel for an overnight stay. Cochin, also known as the ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea,’ is the commercial hub of Kerala, boasting one of the world’s finest natural harbors. This city has been a major center for trade and commerce, with influences from the British, Arabs, Chinese, Portuguese, and Dutch.

• After breakfast, meet with our representative who will provide a detailed briefing about your tour and hand over your travel documents.
  • Begin your sightseeing tour of Cochin with visits to landmarks such as St. Francis Church, India’s oldest European church, built in 1503 by the Portuguese. Vasco da Gama’s remains were originally buried here before being moved to Lisbon, Portugal. See the famous Chinese Fishing Nets, introduced by traders from the court of Kublai Khan.
  • Visit Mattancherry Palace, built by the Portuguese in 1557 and later renovated by the Dutch in 1663. The palace features murals from the Ramayana, Mahabharata, and Hindu legends, along with historical maps and royal artifacts.
  • In the evening, enjoy a Kathakali dance performance, a must-see cultural experience.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Munnar, a picturesque hill station located at an elevation of 1600 meters above sea level. Munnar was once the summer retreat of the British and is famous for its sprawling tea plantations, scenic towns, and beautiful homes. It is also home to exotic flora such as Neelakurunji, which blooms once every 12 years. Anamudi, the highest peak in South India, is also located here, making it an ideal spot for trekking.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free to explore the beauty of this hill station.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• Enjoy a full day to explore Munnar’s natural beauty, tea plantations, and surrounding landscapes. Relax and unwind or take a nature walk through this serene hill station.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Periyar. The Periyar Tiger Reserve, spanning 777 square kilometers, is one of India’s premier wildlife sanctuaries. The reserve is known for its population of wild elephants and its 26-square-kilometer artificial lake created by the Mullaperiyar Dam. A boat cruise on the lake offers a fantastic opportunity to spot wildlife such as elephants, wild boars, and gaur. The reserve also hosts several other mammals and bird species, including the Nilgiri Thar and the lion-tailed macaque.
  • Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy free time to explore the local market.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, explore the wildlife within Periyar Tiger Reserve. Enjoy a boat ride on the Periyar Lake for a close-up view of the sanctuary’s flora and fauna.
  • Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, drive to Kumarakom to board a houseboat for a backwater cruise. Kerala’s backwaters are a unique natural phenomenon, formed by an extensive network of lakes, canals, and rivers draining into the Arabian Sea. The backwaters are an eco-system full of aquatic life, and the canals connect local villages, still used for traditional transport. During the cruise, visit villages, coir factories, tea shops, and paddy fields. The houseboat will anchor in a peaceful location by sunset.
  • Overnight on the houseboat.

• After breakfast, disembark from the houseboat and drive to Kovalam, one of South India’s most famous beach destinations. Kovalam is known for its three beautiful beaches, with the Lighthouse Beach being the most popular.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free to relax on the beach.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a full day of leisure at Kovalam’s tranquil beaches. Spend your time swimming, sunbathing, or strolling along the coastline.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• Another day to relax and unwind on the serene beaches of Kovalam. Take your time to enjoy the beauty of the area at your own pace.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After a leisurely breakfast, enjoy the day at leisure.
  • In time, you will be transferred to Trivandrum Airport for your onward journey.

description.S:
• On arrival in the capital city of India, you will be greeted with a traditional welcome before being transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay. Delhi, a blend of the ancient and the modern, is a city where the past and present coexist harmoniously. As you explore the streets of Delhi, you’ll experience the bustling sounds of rickshaws alongside the sleek Mercedes-Benz cars.
  • The city's diverse food scene offers everything from rich Mughlai curries to wood-fired pizzas.
  • This vibrant city will captivate your senses with its remarkable sights and sounds.

• After breakfast, our representative will provide you with a detailed briefing of your tour and hand over your travel documents.
  • Embark on a full-day sightseeing tour, starting with a visit to Old Delhi.
  • Explore the 17th-century walled city of ShahJahanabad, home to the impressive Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, built in 1656 by Emperor Shah Jahan. Next, take a walk or a rickshaw ride through the bustling lanes of Chandni Chowk, a historic market.
  • Visit the Red Fort, another magnificent structure built by Shah Jahan in 1648.
  • Later, continue your tour in New Delhi, where you will see architectural marvels such as the Qutub Minar, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and Humayun’s Tomb, a prime example of Mughal architecture.
  • Other highlights include India Gate, Lakshmi Narayan Temple, and a drive past the President's House, Parliament House, and Connaught Place.

• After a hearty breakfast, drive to Agra, the city of love. Situated on the banks of the Yamuna River, Agra flourished during the Mughal era, and is home to some of India's most iconic monuments.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel before visiting the Taj Mahal, the stunning white marble monument built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. This masterpiece of Mughal architecture took over 20,000 workers 22 years to complete. The intricate inlay work of precious stones on the marble walls is one of the finest examples of craftsmanship.
  • Afterward, visit the Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its massive structure and historical significance. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Agra to Fatehpur Sikri to Ranthambore

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive towards Ranthambhore, stopping en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, the former capital of the Mughal Empire under Emperor Akbar. Built in 1571 and abandoned shortly after due to water scarcity, Fatehpur Sikri is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
  • Explore the impressive structures, including Akbar’s residential complex, the Mosque, and the Tomb of Salim Chisti.
  • Continue your drive to Ranthambore, arriving at your hotel for an overnight stay.

• Today, enjoy both a morning and an afternoon safari in Ranthambore National Park, one of the largest and most famous tiger reserves in India. The park is home to a variety of wildlife, including the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger, along with various species of birds, reptiles, and mammals.
  • Capture the breathtaking views of the Aravalli Hills and explore the fort and palaces within the park.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Jaipur, the vibrant capital of Rajasthan, also known as the Pink City. Known for its regal palaces, forts, and rich culture, Jaipur is a blend of history and modernity.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel. The remainder of the day is free for leisure activities.

• After breakfast, enjoy a visit to the Amber Fort, where you can ride an elephant to reach the grand fort situated on a hilltop.
  • Later, visit the City Palace, a magnificent blend of Mughal and Rajasthani architecture, and the seven-storied Chandra Mahal, which offers stunning views of the city.
  • Explore Jantar Mantar, the world’s largest astronomical observatory, and see the intricately designed Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, built in 1799 to allow royal women to observe street life from behind its 593 miniature windows.

• After a relaxing breakfast at your hotel, drive back to Delhi.
  • Upon arrival, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward flight.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in India, enjoy a warm traditional welcome before being transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.
  • Cochin, often referred to as the ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea’, is the commercial hub of Kerala, boasting one of the finest natural harbors in the world.
  • Once a thriving center for trade with the British, Arabs, Chinese, Portuguese, and Dutch, Cochin’s rich history and culture are evident in its architecture and ambiance.

• After breakfast, meet with our representative for a briefing about your tour and to receive your travel documents. Then, embark on a city tour to explore Cochin’s historical sites.
  • Visit St. Francis Church, built in 1503 by the Portuguese Franciscan friars, and home to the remains of Vasco da Gama before they were transferred to Lisbon. See the famous Chinese Fishing Nets, introduced by traders from the court of Kublai Khan.
  • Explore Mattancherry Palace, constructed by the Portuguese in 1557 and later renovated by the Dutch in 1663. Admire the vibrant mural paintings depicting scenes from the Ramayana, Mahabharata, and other Hindu epics.
  • In the evening, experience a Kathakali dance performance, a must-see cultural experience in Cochin.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Munnar, a scenic hill station located 1,600 meters above sea level. Once the summer retreat of the British government in South India, Munnar is famous for its lush tea plantations, picturesque towns, and tranquil atmosphere. The region is also known for the rare Neelakurinji flower that blooms once every 12 years, and Anamudi, the highest peak in South India, ideal for trekking.
  • On arrival, check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to explore the scenic beauty of the hill station.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a leisurely day to visit the tea and coffee plantations that make Munnar famous.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Periyar. The Periyar Tiger Reserve, covering 777 square kilometers with 360 square kilometers of dense forest, is one of India's premier wildlife sanctuaries, renowned for its wild elephants.
  • A 26-square-kilometer artificial lake created by the Mullaperiyar Dam is the perfect setting for a boat cruise where you can spot wildlife such as elephants, sambars, wild boar, and the occasional tiger. The park is also home to over 265 species of birds, including hornbills, kingfishers, and cormorants.
  • On arrival, check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to explore the local market.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a safari inside Periyar National Park to spot wildlife in their natural habitat.
  • You can also enjoy a boat ride on Periyar Lake for a closer view of the flora and fauna.
  • Overnight at your hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Kumarakom to board a traditional houseboat for a cruise through the Kerala backwaters. The backwaters, a network of lakes, canals, and estuaries, form a unique ecosystem teeming with aquatic life.
  • You will pass through tranquil villages, paddy fields, and small temples while learning about local life, including coir-making and fishing practices. The boat will anchor at a peaceful location for the night.
  • Overnight on the houseboat.

• After breakfast, drive to Kovalam, one of South India's most beautiful and renowned beach destinations.
  • Kovalam is known for its three stunning beaches, with Lighthouse Beach being the most popular.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to relax on the beach.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a day of leisure, lounging on the beach or taking part in optional water activities.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Another free day to unwind and enjoy the serene beach environment. You can take a stroll along the shoreline, visit nearby attractions, or simply relax and enjoy the sunset.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• After a leisurely breakfast, the day is free for your last-minute shopping or relaxation.
  • In time, you will be transferred to Trivandrum Airport for your onward journey.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in Port Blair in the morning by flight, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel.
  • Visit the Cellular Jail, a historic site that showcases the resilience of Indian freedom fighters.
  • In the evening, attend the captivating Sound and Light Show at the Cellular Jail, which brings to life the heroic struggles of the Indian independence movement.
  • The Hindi show is available daily at 6:00 pm, with additional English shows on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at 7:15 pm.

• After breakfast, proceed to the ferry terminal for your transfer to Havelock Island.
  • Upon arrival, you will be welcomed and transferred to your hotel.
  • Visit Beach No. 7 (Radhanagar Beach), often rated as Asia’s most beautiful beach by Times Magazine.
  • Enjoy a romantic candlelight dinner by the beach.

• Visit Elephant Beach by boat for an opportunity to view the vibrant coral reefs through a glass-bottom boat and enjoy snorkeling.
  • Spend some relaxing time enjoying the beach and the beautiful surroundings.
• Today, you have the option to indulge in thrilling activities such as Discover Scuba Diving, experience sport fishing, or continue snorkeling in exclusive and pristine locations around the island.

• After breakfast, head to the jetty and board the ferry back to Port Blair.
  • Upon arrival, you will be transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

• Enjoy a half-day excursion to Ross Island, once the administrative headquarters of the British in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands before India’s independence.
  • Explore the historical ruins and learn about its fascinating past.
• At the appropriate time, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward journey back home.

description.S: • Arrive at Delhi airport, meet your coach, and proceed towards Chandigarh.

• Drive towards Manali, with a stop en route to visit Vaishnomata Mandir at Kullu.
  • Arrive in Manali by the evening.

name.S: Manali to Solang Valley and Back

description.S:
• Start the day with water rafting in the Beas River (subject to weather conditions). Then head to Solang Valley, a stunning location between Solang Village and Beas Kund, offering breathtaking views of glaciers, snow-capped mountains, and ski slopes.
  • Note: For safety reasons, children under 12 years of age or weighing less than 35 kg are not permitted for water rafting.

name.S: Manali to Rohtang Snow Point and Back

description.S:
• Enjoy a scenic drive to Rohtang Snow Point, where you will have free time to play and enjoy the snow.
  • Note: Rohtang Pass is 51 km away from Manali and is covered with snow for most of the year.
  • We typically visit a snow point on the Rohtang road, as permitted by the Border Security Force.

• Explore ancient temples in the morning, including Jagatsukh Gayatri Mandir, Vashista Kund, and Hidimba Mandir.
  • The rest of the day is free for shopping or leisure activities.
  • In the evening, enjoy a get-together with your travel companions.

• Proceed back to Chandigarh, with a visit to Kullu Valley and the Shawl Factory in Kullu.
  • Arrive in Chandigarh by evening.
• Head towards Delhi, where you will board your flight back home. Tour concludes.

description.S:
• 3:00 pm to 4:00 pm: Check-in at Taj West End
  • 4:00 pm to 5:00 pm: High Tea at the Banquet Hall
  • 5:00 pm to 5:30 pm: Presentation on The Golden Chariot Tour, covering dos and don’ts, safety, and security.
  • 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm: Visit to Chitrakala Parishad / Art Gallery
  • 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm: Enjoy a Cultural Show
  • 8:00 pm: Arrive at Yeshwantpur Railway Station, Platform No. 6, for a traditional Indian welcome.
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot
  • 9:00 pm: Depart for Mysore

    • Alternate Itinerary
  • 11:00 am: Check-in at Our Native Village
  • 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm: Lunch
  • 3:00 pm to 3:30 pm: Resort Tour – Learn what makes us a 100% eco-resort
  • 4:00 pm to 4:30 pm: Herbal & Medicinal Plant Tour and Organic Farm Tour
  • 4:30 pm to 5:30 pm: Pottery Session & Explore traditional village games and enjoy Bullock Cart Rides
  • 6:00 pm to 6:30 pm: Rest before departing for Yeshwantpur Railway Station
    • (Note: Alternate itinerary is for those who choose not to check-in at Leela Palace and participate in the Bangalore sightseeing tour.)

• 10:00 am: Depart for Kabini / Bandipur after breakfast
  • 1:00 pm: Arrive at Jungle Lodge for Lunch
  • Post-lunch: Go for a Jungle Safari / Boat Safari
  • Evening: Watch a wildlife film
  • Dinner and overnight stay at Jungle Lodge

    • Alternate Itinerary
  • Visit Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary
  • Explore Mysore Zoo
  • Lunch onboard
  • Visit Brindavan Gardens
  • Kabini: A Wildlife Haven
  • Rajiv Gandhi National Park (Nagarhole/Kabini) is an ideal destination for wildlife enthusiasts. A safari through the heart of the park offers sightings of elephants, gaur, sambar, and even elusive predators like tigers and leopards. The park is home to over 300 bird species, making it a bird watcher's paradise.

• 8:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 11:30 am: Return to The Golden Chariot
  • 1:00 pm: Lunch onboard
  • 3:00 pm: Mysore sightseeing - Visit Mysore Palace and Srirangapatnam.
  • 7:00 pm: Arrive at Lalitha Mahal Palace for a cultural show, followed by dinner
  • 10:00 pm: Back onboard The Golden Chariot

    • Mysore: A Royal Legacy
    Mysore is known for its royal heritage, splendid palaces, and majestic buildings. It is also famous for its music, dance, arts, and crafts. The Mysore Palace, built in Indo-Saracenic style, is a treasure trove of art and architecture. Visit Srirangapatnam, Tipu Sultan’s fortress, which houses important historical sites like the mosque and the dungeons were British officers were held captive.

• 6:00 am: Depart from Mysore to Hassan
  • 8:15 am: Arrive at Hassan
  • 9:00 am: Depart for Shravanabelagola (Note: A climb of 700 steps is required to reach the statue. Palanquins are available for those who prefer not to climb.)
  • 1:00 pm: Lunch onboard
  • 3:00 pm: Depart for Belur and Halebid for sightseeing
  • 7:15 pm: Back onboard The Golden Chariot
  • 7:45 pm: Depart for Hospet
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot

    • Belur & Halebid: A World of Worship
    Belur is famous for its stunning Hoysala Temple Complex, including the Chennakesava Temple, which showcases intricate sculptures. Halebid, once the capital of the Hoysala dynasty, is home to the beautiful Hoysaleswara Temple. Shravanabelagola features Asia’s largest monolithic statue of Lord Gomateswara, standing 58 feet tall.

• 6:00 am: Arrive in Hospet
  • 8:30 am: After breakfast, depart for Hampi sightseeing: Virupaksha Temple, Queens’ Bath, Elephant Stables, and the Local Crafts Bazaar
  • 1:00 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Lunch
  • 3:00 pm: Continue sightseeing: Royal Enclosure, Hazara Rama Temple, and Illuminated Vittala Temple
  • 8:00 pm: Return onboard The Golden Chariot for Dinner

    • Hampi: A World Heritage Site
    Hampi, once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire, is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The ruins, scattered across 26 square kilometers, tell tales of grandeur and glory. Explore the temples and palaces, including the Vittala Temple, which features an impressive stone chariot.

• 5:00 am: Depart from Hospet to Badami
  • Arrive in Badami around 8:30 am.
  • 9:00 am: After breakfast, explore the Badami Caves and Pattadakal
  • 1:30 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Lunch
  • 2:00 pm: Depart for Goa.
  • Relax onboard and enjoy facilities like the Spa and Gym
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot
  • Reach Goa post-midnight

    • Badami: A World Heritage Site
    Badami, with its stunning rock-cut temples and caves, offers a glimpse into India’s rich history. Pattadakal, known for its Chalukyan architecture, is another UNESCO World Heritage site and a testament to the region’s cultural richness.

• 9:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 10:00 am: Depart for Goa sightseeing
  • 11:00 am: Visit the famous churches of Old Goa
  • 12:15 pm: Explore an old Portuguese house: Sola Souto Maior for tea/coffee and shopping
  • 2:00 pm: Lunch at Majorda Beach Resort
  • 3:00 pm: Relax with an Ayurvedic massage, visit the casino, or enjoy the pool and beach (extra charges apply)
  • 6:00 pm: Depart from the resort
  • 7:15 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Dinner
  • 9:00 pm: Depart for Bangalore

    • Goa: A World of Golden Beaches
    Goa is known for its beautiful beaches, colonial architecture, and relaxed pace of life. With its rich history, stunning landscapes, and vibrant culture, Goa is more than just a beach destination.

• 8:00 am to 9:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 11:00 am: Arrive at Yeshwantpur Railway Station, where you’ll be farewelled by the entire crew.

Overview: Step aboard the Golden Chariot, a luxury train that takes you on an unforgettable journey through South India’s rich history, stunning landscapes, and vibrant culture. This award-winning train offers world-class amenities and visits some of the most iconic destinations, including ancient temples, palaces, and wildlife sanctuaries. Whether you’re a history enthusiast or a lover of luxury, this tour is designed to give you a royal experience.

description.S:
• Embark on a luxurious journey aboard the Royal Rajasthan on Wheels for a seven-day exploration through the vibrant state of Rajasthan.
  • The adventure begins in New Delhi, where your royal journey commences, taking you through the magnificent former princely states of India.
  • Upon your arrival at Safdarjung Station, you will be welcomed with a traditional greeting, including a ceremonial aarti, tika, garlanding, and refreshing mocktails.
  • After check-in, you will be escorted to your private cabin. Experience the true essence of royal life aboard a moving palace, where luxury and tradition are seamlessly combined.

name.S: Monday, Arrival at 09:15 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 17:10 PM Jodhpur

description.S:
• The second-largest city in Rajasthan, Jodhpur, is renowned for its magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, which stands as a symbol of Rajput glory.
  • Another highlight is Jaswant Thada, a marble cenotaph built in 1899. Enjoy lunch at a hotel, and in the evening, return to the train for dinner onboard.

name.S: Tuesday, Arrival at 08:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 14:30 PM Udaipur

description.S:
• Known as the 'Venice of the East,' Udaipur is a mesmerizing city filled with royal palaces, gardens, and temples. It embodies the dreams of Rajputana grandeur. Explore the City Palace, which is a testament to the city’s regal past.
  • After lunch at a hotel, enjoy a visit to the Crystal Gallery, home to exquisite collections of crystal artifacts.

name.S: Tuesday, Arrival at 16:45 PM | Departure at 22:00 PM Chittorgarh

description.S:
• Chittorgarh Fort is steeped in history, telling the tale of valor, sacrifice, and bravery. The Vijay Stambh (Victory Tower) and the Gaumukh Reservoir, along with the Palace of Queen Padmini, are among the key attractions here.
  • In the evening, enjoy the captivating light and sound show at the fort. Afterward, head to a hotel for a cultural performance, followed by dinner.

name.S: Wednesday, Arrival at 05:30 AM, Breakfast onboard or at Hotel Vinayak | Departure at 11:00 AM Sawai Madhopur

description.S:
• The famed Ranthambore National Park and Ranthambore Fort are located in the eastern part of Rajasthan. The park is home to majestic tigers and other wildlife, offering a fantastic safari experience. Also, visit the Amareshwar Mohadeo Temple en route.
  • Enjoy lunch onboard before continuing your journey.

name.S: Wednesday, Arrival at 13:15 PM | Departure at 22:15 PM Jaipur

description.S:
• In Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, you’ll be welcomed by caparisoned elephants and the sounds of the Shehnai.
  • Visit the Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds) and experience an elephant ride at Amber Fort.
  • After shopping for centuries-old artifacts, enjoy a visit to the City Palace, the residence of the former Maharaja, which houses a museum filled with fascinating historical artifacts.
  • Lunch at a hotel and dinner at a hotel with a cultural program follow.

name.S: Thursday, Arrival at 11:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 18:30 PM Khajuraho

description.S:
• The Khajuraho Temples, built between the 9th and 12th centuries, are famous for their intricate sculptures depicting passion, eroticism, dance, music, and other aspects of Indian culture.
  • Located in Madhya Pradesh, these temples are masterpieces of architecture and artistry, with only 20 of them surviving the test of time.
  • Visit the temples and museum, and enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

name.S: Friday, Arrival at 06:00 AM | Departure at 18:00 PM Varanasi

description.S:
• The spiritual capital of India, Varanasi, is over 3,000 years old and is famous for its temples and sacred ghats along the Ganges River.
  • Visit the Jyotirlinga Visvanatha Temple (Golden Temple) and the Jnana Vapi well.
  • Experience the vibrant Maha Aarti ceremony at the ghats and visit the Buddhist temples at Sarnath.
  • After a hotel lunch, return for dinner onboard.

name.S: Saturday, Arrival at 05:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 23:00 PM Agra

description.S:
• Famous for the iconic Taj Mahal and the historic Agra Fort, Agra is a must-visit destination for any traveler. The city is also known for its rich culture and craftsmanship, including marble inlay work, leather goods, footwear, and brassware.
  • After a visit to the Taj Mahal and other attractions, enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

name.S: Sunday, Arrival at 07:00 AM, Breakfast onboard, Check-out at 07:45 AM Delhi

description.S: The Royal Rajasthan on Wheels journey concludes as you arrive back in Delhi, marking the end of this magnificent week-long exploration.

Name: Royal Rajasthan on Wheels
Title: Best Rajasthan Tour Packages India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore the rich heritage of Rajasthan with our customized tour packages. Book your adventure today and experience royal palaces, forts, and vibrant culture.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather and festive celebrations.
  • Ideal For: Families, couples, solo travelers, and history enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, sunscreen, and a camera.
  • Customization options available for personalized itineraries.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in heritage hotels or luxury resorts
  • Daily breakfast and dinner
  • Private transportation for sightseeing and transfers
  • Guided tours to historic forts, palaces, and temples
  • Camel safari and cultural evening in the desert (optional)
  • Entry tickets to monuments and attractions
  • Airport or railway station transfers
Overview: Dive into the regal charm of Rajasthan with our Rajasthan Tour Packages. Known for its rich history, majestic palaces, golden deserts, and vibrant culture, Rajasthan is a destination that captures the heart of every traveler. Whether you’re exploring Jaipur’s Pink City, the blue streets of Jodhpur, or the golden sands of Jaisalmer, this tour promises an enchanting experience filled with unforgettable memories.

description.S:
• The journey begins at Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station, where guests are warmly welcomed with traditional ceremonies before embarking on the Palace-on-Wheels for a week-long luxurious tour through the enchanting state of Rajasthan.
  • Reporting Time: 18:00 hrs, Departure: 18:30 hrs.

• The first destination is Jaipur, one of the most well-planned cities of its time and the capital of Rajasthan. Known as the Pink City, it was founded by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II in 1727 A.D.
  • A guided tour takes you to Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), a remarkable five-story building with semi-octagonal, honeycombed windows that adorn the main street in pink splendor.
  • Next, visit Amber Fort, where you can enjoy an elephant ride to ascend the hill.
  • After lunch at a five-star hotel, continue your exploration with a visit to the City Palace Museum and Jantar Mantar (Observatory).
  • Arrival: 03:45 hrs and Departure: 20:00 hrs.

• Arriving in Sawai Madhopur, named after Maharaja Sawai Madho Singh I, you will visit the Ranthambore National Park after breakfast. Known for its 10th-century fort ruins, this sanctuary is famous for offering one of the best opportunities in India to photograph and observe tigers in their natural habitat.
  • The park spans over 392 sq. km and is home to over 300 species of birds and a variety of carnivorous animals, including tigers, hyenas, and jackals.
  • Sawai Madhopur is also known for its exclusive toys, ethnic ornaments, and costumes.
  • Afterward, travel to Chittorgarh, enjoying the beautiful countryside views.
  • Arrival: 05:30 hrs and Departure: 10:20 hrs
  • Arrival in Chittorgarh: 16:00 hrs and Departure: 02:00 hrs (next day, Saturday)

• Next, the Palace-on-Wheels arrives in Udaipur, also known as the Lake City. Founded in 1559 A.D. by Maharana Udai Singh of the Mewar dynasty, the city is renowned for its beautiful marble palaces that rise majestically from Lake Pichola.
  • Two of the most stunning sites in Udaipur are the Jag Niwas (Lake Palace) and Jag Mandir, which look like dreamlike castles floating on the water.
  • After lunch at a five-star hotel, enjoy a visit to the City Palace, a grand complex with intricate architecture.
  • Arrival: 08:00 hrs and Departure: 15:30 hrs

• Located in the heart of the Thar Desert, Jaisalmer was founded by Rawal Jaisal in 1156 A.D. The impressive Yellow Sandstone Fort dominates the city, offering breathtaking views.
  • Explore the finely carved havelis, such as Nathmalji-ki-Haveli, Patwon-ki-Haveli, and Salim Singh-ki-Haveli, which showcase the exquisite skills of stone carvers.
  • You can shop for locally crafted goods such as pattu shawls, mirror work, embroidered articles, wooden trinkets, silver jewelry, and unique curios.
  • After lunch on board, take an exciting camel ride on the sand dunes of Sam and enjoy a refreshing cup of tea.
  • In the evening, enjoy dinner and a cultural performance at a five-star hotel.
  • Arrival: 09:15 hrs and Departure: 23:30 hrs

• Arriving in Jodhpur, a city surrounded by a high stone wall with seven gates, you’ll explore Mehrangarh Fort, founded in 1459 A.D. by Rao Jodha. This massive fort is home to impressive palaces, including Moti Mahal, Sheesh Mahal, Phool Mahal, and Sileh Khana.
  • Visit Jaswant Thada, a white marble cenotaph near the fort. After lunch at a palace hotel, return to the Palace-on-Wheels and shop for exquisite handicrafts such as embroidered shoes, metal curios, silverware, paintings, and tie-dye fabrics.
  • Arrival: 07:00 hrs and Departure: 16:30 hrs

• In the morning, visit Bharatpur, the capital of Maharaja Suraj Mal, and explore the world-famous Keoladeo Ghana National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its diverse birdlife, including migratory Siberian Cranes, Egrets, and other species.
  • Arrival: 05:00 hrs and Departure: 08:45 hrs
  • Arriving in Agra, visit the majestic Agra Fort and, after lunch, proceed to the iconic Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World. This pristine monument of eternal love was built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife, Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Agra is also renowned for its marble inlay work, leather goods, and jewelry.
  • Arrival: 10:00 hrs and Departure: 19:30 hrs

• The Palace-on-Wheels returns to Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station, where your unforgettable journey concludes.
  • Enjoy a final breakfast onboard and reminisce about the beautiful experiences of the past week.
  • Arrival: 07:30 hrs

Name: Palace on Wheels
LocationDescription: New Delhi - Jaipur - Sawai Madhopur - Chittorgarh - Udaipur - Jaisalmer - Jodhpur - Bharatpur - Agra - Delhi
