Overview: Experience the grandeur of India with the Palace on Wheels, one of the most luxurious trains in the world. This extraordinary journey takes you through India’s most iconic destinations, offering a blend of royal heritage, vibrant culture, and stunning landscapes. From the majestic forts of Rajasthan to the timeless beauty of the Taj Mahal, this package promises a royal experience like no other.

name.S: Arrive in Delhi (Normal check-in time at the hotel is 14:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Arrive at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where you will be met by our representative holding a placard in the arrival lounge.
  • After a warm welcome, transfer to your hotel and check-in. Delhi, the capital of India, is a city of contrasts – a vibrant metropolis where history and modernity coexist. The city has been the seat of many great dynasties, leaving behind a legacy of architectural wonders.
  • Located on the banks of the Yamuna River, Delhi has seen numerous cities rise and fall over the last five millennia.
  • Overnight in Delhi.

• Start your day with a hearty breakfast at the hotel.
  • Afterward, enjoy a full-day sightseeing tour of both Old and New Delhi.
    • Morning:
    Explore Old Delhi with a drive past the Red Fort (outside only), an iconic citadel made of red sandstone built by Shah Jahan in the 17th century. Nearby, visit Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque, also commissioned by Shah Jahan. Take a rickshaw ride through the bustling Chandni Chowk, a vibrant market area full of shops selling everything from clothes to spices. If time permits, visit Raj Ghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi.
    Afternoon:
    Continue your exploration of New Delhi with a visit to the Qutub Minar, a UNESCO World Heritage site and the tallest brick minaret in the world. See the Iron Pillar, which has baffled scientists for its resistance to rust for over 1,600 years. Then, visit Humayun's Tomb, a stunning example of Mughal architecture and a precursor to the Taj Mahal. Also stop by India Gate, the national war memorial, and the Rashtrapati Bhawan, the residence of India’s President.Overnight in Delhi.

name.S: Delhi to Agra (Approx. 205 km / 5 to 5.5 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast at your hotel, drive to Agra, home to the world-famous Taj Mahal.
  • Upon arrival, check in at your hotel. Agra is a city steeped in Mughal history, known for its stunning palaces, forts, and mausoleums that reflect the grandeur of the empire.
  • Agra was the capital of the Mughal Empire for over 100 years. It is also famous for its intricate marble inlay work, leather products, and carpets.
  • Overnight in Agra.

name.S: Agra to Varanasi (Overnight Train) (Normal check-out time is 12:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Start your day with breakfast at the hotel, then head out for a tour of Agra’s major attractions.
  • Visit the Taj Mahal, the eternal symbol of love built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Closed on Fridays, this exquisite white marble mausoleum is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
  • Then, explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and Itimad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb, often referred to as the 'Baby Taj' due to its resemblance to the Taj Mahal.
  • In the evening, transfer to Agra Railway Station to board your overnight train to Varanasi.
  • Train Details:
  • Train Name/Number: Marudhar Express – 14864
  • Departure from Agra: 21:20 hrs
  • Arrival in Varanasi: 08:35 hrs (Next morning)
  • Proposed Class: 3 Tier Air-conditioned Sleeper

name.S: Arrive in Varanasi (Normal check-in time at the hotel is 12:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Upon arrival at Mughal Sarai Railway Station, you will be transferred to your hotel.
  • Varanasi (also known as Kashi or Benaras) is one of the world’s oldest living cities and the holiest city in India for Hindus. It has been a center for culture, education, and spirituality for over 2,000 years.
  • In the afternoon, visit the Banaras Hindu University and the famous Bharat Kala Bhavan Museum.
  • Explore the Bharat Mata Temple, Durga Temple, and Vishwanath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva.
  • In the evening, witness the mesmerizing Aarti ceremony at Dashashwamedh Ghat.
  • Overnight in Varanasi.

• Early in the morning, enjoy a boat ride on the Ganges River at sunrise, a serene and spiritual experience as pilgrims perform their rituals.
  • As you float past the ghats, you’ll see people praying, bathing, and performing last rites.
  • Visit the burning ghats, where the deceased are cremated in the traditional manner.
  • In the afternoon, travel to Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment.
  • Explore the Chowkandi Stupa, Dhamek Stupa, and the ruins of ancient monasteries. Don’t miss the Sarnath Museum (closed on Fridays).
  • Overnight in Varanasi.

name.S: Varanasi to Bodhgaya (Approx. 242 km / 5 to 6 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Bodhgaya, the site where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree.
  • Visit the Mahabodhi Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, with its stunning architecture and a large gilded statue of Buddha.
  • The temple complex is home to a tree descended from the original Bodhi tree.
  • Overnight in Bodhgaya.

• After breakfast, proceed for an excursion to Rajgir and Nalanda.
  • In Rajgir, visit the Vishwa Shanti Stupa and the Saptaparni Caves, where the first Buddhist council was held.
  • See the Bimbisara Jail and Jarasandha’s Akhra. Later, continue to Nalanda, an ancient university and center of Buddhist learning from the 5th to 12th centuries.
  • Explore the ruins of the university and visit the Nalanda Museum.
  • Return to Bodhgaya for the night.
  • Overnight in Bodhgaya.

• After breakfast, drive to Vaishali, where Buddha delivered his last sermon.
  • Visit the Ashoka Pillar and the Lotus Tank. Then, continue to Kushinagar, the site where Buddha attained Mahaparinirvana (final liberation).
  • Explore the monuments and the Parinirvana Stupa, marking the place where Buddha passed away.
  • Overnight in Kushinagar.

name.S: Kushinagar to Lumbini (Approx. 173 km / 4 to 5 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Lumbini, the birthplace of Buddha.
  • En route, visit the Mahakala Caves. In Lumbini, explore the Ashoka Pillar, the Maya Devi Temple, and the Lumbini Museum, which highlights the history of Buddha's birth and early life.
  • Overnight in Lumbini.

name.S: Lumbini to Kapilvastu & Shravasti (Approx. 86 km to Kapilvastu & 147 km to Shravasti)

description.S:
• Visit Ashoka’s Pillar in Lumbini before heading to Kapilvastu, the site of the ancient city where Buddha spent his early years.
  • Continue to Shravasti, a key place for Buddhists, where Buddha performed miracles.
  • Visit the ruins and the Jetavana Monastery.
  • Overnight in Shravasti.

name.S: Shravasti to Gorakhpur & Delhi (Overnight Train) (Approx. 51 km to Gorakhpur)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Gorakhpur and board your overnight train back to Delhi.
  • Train Details:
  • Train Name/Number: Vaishali Exp. – 12553
  • Departure from Gorakhpur: 17:05 hrs
  • Arrival in Delhi: 06:30 hrs (Next morning)
  • Proposed Class: 3 Tier Air-conditioned Sleeper

• Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward journey.
  • End of tour.

Name: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour
Title: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour Package India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore India’s sacred sites with our Buddhist pilgrimage tour package. Visit Delhi, Agra, Varanasi, Bodhgaya, Vaishali, Kushinagar, Shravasti, & Gorakhpur.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather.
  • Ideal For: Spiritual seekers, history enthusiasts, and cultural travelers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, walking shoes, and a notebook for reflections.
  • Customizable itineraries are available based on your preferences.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.
Whats_Included:

  • Daily breakfast and vegetarian meals
  • Private transportation for all transfers and sightseeing
  • Guided tours to Buddhist sites
  • Entry tickets to monuments and temples
  • Professional tour guides with expertise in Buddhist heritage
  • Assistance with travel permits where required
Overview: Embark on a transformative journey with our Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour Package, exploring the sacred sites that trace the life and teachings of Lord Buddha. From the enlightenment at Bodh Gaya to the first sermon at Sarnath, this package is designed for spiritual seekers and cultural enthusiasts alike. Immerse yourself in the tranquility and profound wisdom of Buddhism as you visit these revered destinations.

description.S:
• Upon your arrival in Delhi, our tour representative will meet you and assist you in smooth transfer to Rishikesh via road.
  • Upon arrival in Rishikesh, check in at the hotel. The evening is free to relax and briefing.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Rishikesh:
    The birthplace of Yoga, Rishikesh is located 24 kilometers away from HarIdwar. It is a place where pilgrims come to meditate, do yoga and learn about other aspects of Hinduism. There are many ancient and newly built temples along the river Ganges. The whole town is consIdered to be sacred and it is saId that meditation here leads to salvation.

• After morning breakfast, embark on a local sightseeing tour of Rishikesh which includes Ram Jhula, Laxman Jhula, and Swarg Ashram.
  • Later, drive to Barkot via Mussoorie. On the way, visit Kempty Falls and reach Barkot by late evening.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Barkot – Jankichatti – Yamunotri – Barkot (50 kms & 6 kms. Trek)

description.S:
• After morning breakfast, proceed to Yamunotri and later move up to Jankichatti.
  • Enjoy a 6 km trek to Yamunotri. Here, one can cook rice by packing it in a cloth and dipping it in the hot water of the Kund. Pilgrims take this cooked rice home as “Prasad”.
  • Nearby the temple, Pooja can be offered to Divya Shila after taking a bath in Jamunabai Kund and offering prayers to Yamunaji.
  • Later, return to Barkot. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Yamunotri:
  • The source of the river Yamuna and the seat of the river goddess, Yamunotri is situated at an altitude of 3,293 meters in the Garhwal Himalayas.
  • It originates from the Champasar Glacier, located 1 kilometer ahead of the shrine. Yamunotri was the home of an ancient sage, ‘Asit Muni’.
  • The goddess Yamuna is the daughter of the Sun, and Yama is the brother of the river goddess. It is believed that taking a dip in the holy waters of Yamuna provides blessings.
  • Surya Kund: Surya Kund is a hot water spring containing sulfur, known for its healing properties.
  • Divya Shila: Divya Shila is a rock pillar worshipped before entering the Yamunotri temple.
  • Travel to Gangotri, take a holy dip in the river, and visit the temple.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Uttarkashi. Later, drive to Harsil.
  • The evening is free for leisure and exploring local attractions.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, take a road trip to Gangotri. After praying at the temple, have Pooja & Darshan at Gangotri temple.
  • Later, return back to Uttarkashi. Dinner and overnight stay at Uttarkashi.

    • Gangotri:
    Located in the 18th century, Gangotri is dedicated to Hindu goddess ‘Ganga’. It is located near a sacred stone where Bhagirath worshipped Lord Shiva and asked to hold Ganga in his matted locks. The temple is a beautiful 20 feet high structure made up of white granite. This is the perfect place to reconnect with you. The Gangotri temple dedicated to the goddess remains open from May to November.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Guptkashi. En route, see the heritage city of Tehri submerged into the mighty waters of the holy river Ganges.
  • Later in the evening, you’ll have to reach Guptkashi.
  • Dinner and stay overnight at the hotel.

    • Guptkashi:
    Located in the northern Himalayan belt within the Mandakini river valley, which houses lush green forests, Guptkashi is famous for the Vishwanath temple- dedicated to Lord Shiva.

• Post breakfast, take a road trip up to Helipad as per the reporting time.
  • Complete the boarding formalities and wait here for your time slot.
  • Upon arrival at Kedarnath, perform early Pooja & Darshan at the temple. Later, return back to Helipad and take a return flight to Guptkashi, before you drive back to Rudraprayag.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Kedarnath Temple:
    Built in the 8th century A.D. by Adi Guru Shankaracharya, the Kedarnath Temple is located adjacent to the site of an ancient temple built by Pandavas. As the name suggests, the temple is dedicated to the shrine of Kedar. Kedarnath is one of the four holy places that cover the famous Char Dham Yatra. It is believed to be one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. The temple is believed to be over 1000 years old.

• Post breakfast, take a road trip to Badrinath. On the way, visit Narsingh Temple and Adi Shankaracharya Samadhi at Joshimath.
  • Later, drive to Badrinath and do Pooja & Darshan at the temple.
  • Thereafter, visit the famous tourist sites in Badrinath such as Vyas Cave, Ganesh Cave, Bhim Bridge, and the origin of River Saraswati at Mana Village, the last village before entering the Tibetan border.
  • Later, visit the temple for holy Darshan/Pooja and attend evening Aarti.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Badrinath Temple:
    One of the holiest temples in Uttarakhand, Badrinath is nestled between the twin mountain ranges - Nar and Narayan. Badrinath Temple is also known as Badrinarayan temple because it is dedicated to Lord Vishnu’s form of Badrinarayan. The temple is supposed to have been built by the 8th century saint ‘Adi Shankracharya’, the great scholar and philosopher. The original temple was destroyed in a landslIde. The present temple is believed to have been built by the Garhwal kings in the 17th century.
    Narad Kund:
    Narad Kund is one of the most revered centers in Badrinath. It is a holy site from where Adi Sankara recovered the Idol of Lord Vishnu.
    Brahma Kapal:
    It is a flat platform located on the banks of the Alaknanda River, where Lord Brahma is believed to resIde. The devotees pay homage and rituals to the departed souls.
    Sheshnetra:
    Located on the opposite bank of the river, Sheshnetra is a place where the eye of the serpent lord ‘Shesha’ on which Vishnu rests, is seen on a rock.
    Mana Village:
    Mana Village is a quaint tiny hamlet located on the Indo-Tibetan border. The village is now declared as a tourism village of India.
    Bhim Pul:
    It is an attractive rock brIdge in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand. Just 4 kms away from Mana Village, this natural brIdge lies over the roaring Saraswati River.
    Vyas Gufa (Cave):
    Located at a distance of 3 kilometers away from Badrinath temple, Vyas Gufa is a rock-cave where Ved Vyas is believed to have composed the Mahabharata and the Puranic commentaries.

• In the morning, after Mahaabhishek, go for Pooja and Darshan.
  • Post breakfast, leave by road for Srinagar.
  • On the way, visit Vishnuprayag, Nandprayag, Karnprayag, and Rudraprayag.
  • Later, take a road trip to Srinagar.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Haridwar.
  • On the way, visit Devprayag, the confluence of Alaknanda and Bhagirathi River.
  • In the afternoon, you will arrive in Haridwar. Later, check into the hotel and get relaxed.
  • Visit the famous places such as Mansa Devi and Chandi Devi Temples.
  • In the evening, attend the famous Ganga Aarti at Har ki Pauri. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Haridwar:
    Located at the feet of Shiva’s hills ‘Shivaliks’, HarIdwar is located in the HarIdwar district of Uttarakhand. It is one of the 7 holiest Hindu cities in India. Apart from being a famous tourist destination in India, HarIdwar is also famous among the people as being the location of Kumbh Mela. The lighted diyas floating on the river Ganges creates a spectacular sight. The town is dotted with innumerable temples and other religious places.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Delhi.
  • On reaching Delhi, drop at the railway station for onward journey.

Name: Chardham tour
Title: Chardham Pilgrimage Tour Package India – Eaze Tours
Description: Embark on a spiritual journey with our Chardham pilgrimage tour package in India, covering Delhi, Rishikesh, Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath, & more.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: May to October, as the temples are open to pilgrims during this period.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, spiritual seekers, and families seeking blessings.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, warm attire (especially for Kedarnath), and essentials for travel.
  • Physical Fitness: Some trekking is required, especially to Kedarnath and Yamunotri.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in comfortable hotels or guesthouses
  • Daily breakfast and meals as per the itinerary
  • Private transport for all transfers and sightseeing
  • Experienced guides for temple visits and local tours
  • Entry fees to temples and sanctuaries
  • Assistance with Darshan and poojas (if required)
  • All necessary permits and arrangements
Overview: Embark on a divine and spiritually enriching journey with our Chardham Pilgrimage Tour Package, taking you to the four sacred shrines of Uttarakhand: Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. These revered destinations are considered the spiritual gateways to liberation and are believed to cleanse the soul. This tour offers an unforgettable experience for devotees seeking divine blessings and peace.

description.S:
• Upon your arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport, you will be greeted by our representative who will assist you with your transfer to the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, embark on a sightseeing tour of Old Delhi.
  • Visit the Jama Masjid, take a drive past the Red Fort, and visit Raj Ghat, where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated.
  • Experience the hustle and bustle of Old Delhi with a rickshaw ride.
  • Next, visit the Gurudwara Shri Bangla Sahib (Sikh Temple), one of the holiest pilgrimage sites for the Sikh community in India. This site was once a residence for Guru Hari Krishan, the eighth Sikh Guru, during his visit to Delhi in 1664. The Gurudwara now stands as a monument to the Guru’s memory and welcomes thousands of visitors every day.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After breakfast, you will be transferred to the railway station to board the Swarna Shatabdi Express (Train No. 12029). The train departs from Delhi at 07:20 AM and arrives in Amritsar at 1:35 PM (AC chair car class).
  • Upon arrival, meet our representative and transfer to your hotel.
  • Amritsar is home to the magnificent Golden Temple, the spiritual heart of Sikhism. This iconic temple, with its golden domes reflected in the shimmering water of the surrounding pool, offers a serene and spiritual atmosphere.
  • In the evening, visit the Golden Temple for a memorable experience.
  • Overnight stay in Amritsar.

• After breakfast, enjoy a full day of sightseeing in Amritsar. Visit the Golden Temple, the spiritual center of Sikhism, established by Guru Arjan in the late 16th century. Explore the Akal Takht, the highest political institution of the Sikhs.
  • Pay a visit to Jallianwala Bagh, the site of the tragic massacre of 1919. You will also visit the Wagah Border to witness the spectacular Border Retreat Ceremony between India and Pakistan.
  • Overnight stay in Amritsar.

name.S: Amritsar – Dharamshala (195 km / Approx. 4 hours drive)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Dharamshala, beautifully situated on the slopes of the Dhauladhar range.
  • The town rises from 1250 m to 2000 m in altitude and offers scenic views of the snow-capped peaks.
  • Overnight stay in Dharamshala.

• After breakfast, explore McLeod Ganj, a suburb often referred to as 'Little Lhasa' because it is the home of the Dalai Lama and the Tibetan Government in Exile.
  • Visit Namgyal Monastery, the main center for monks’ training, and the Tibetan Village School. Learn about Tibetan culture and history while strolling through this peaceful settlement.
  • Overnight stay in Dharamshala.

name.S: Dharamshala – Shimla (239 km / Approx. 5 hours drive)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Shimla.
  • Upon arrival, check into your hotel, and later explore the town's famous landmarks, including the Shimla Mosque (built in 1830), ViceRegal Lodge, Christ Church (1844), Gaiety Theatre, Scandal Point, Kaali Baari Temple, and Jakhoo Temple.
  • The evening is free for shopping at the famous Mall Road.
  • Overnight stay in Shimla.

• After breakfast, take an excursion to Kufri, a popular hill station near Shimla.
  • Visit the Himalayan National Park, enjoy a pony and yak ride, and take in panoramic views of the surrounding Himalayan range. You can also visit Chail, which boasts the world’s highest cricket ground.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay in Shimla.

name.S: Shimla – Rishikesh (275 km / Approx. 6 hours drive)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Rishikesh, a town renowned for its religious significance and connection to yoga. Situated on the banks of the Ganges, Rishikesh is a haven for spiritual seekers and travelers alike.
  • Overnight stay in Rishikesh.

• In Rishikesh, visit the Ram Jhula and Lakshman Jhula, the iconic suspension bridges over the Ganges. Explore the numerous ashrams and temples that dot the town.
  • Later, drive to Haridwar, a significant pilgrimage destination, and visit Har Ki Pauri, a sacred ghat where the famous Ganga Aarti is performed every evening.
  • Explore the Mansa Devi Temple located atop a hill.
  • Return to Rishikesh for an overnight stay.

name.S: Rishikesh – Delhi (235 km / Approx. 5 hours drive)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive back to Delhi.
  • En route, pass by India Gate and Rashtrapati Bhawan (Presidential Residence).
  • Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After breakfast, head to the airport for your flight to Varanasi.
  • Upon arrival in Varanasi, meet our representative and transfer to your hotel.
  • Varanasi is one of India’s most important pilgrimage sites and is known for its ghats along the Ganges, the heart of spiritual life in the city.
  • In the evening, attend the Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat.
  • Overnight stay in Varanasi.

• Early morning, enjoy a boat ride on the Ganges River during sunrise.
  • Watch as pilgrims perform rituals, offering prayers and bathing in the holy river.
  • Afterward, visit the Banaras Hindu University and its museum, Bharat Kala Bhavan, which houses impressive collections of Mughal miniatures and textiles.
  • In the afternoon, visit Sarnath, where Lord Buddha delivered his first sermon, and explore the ancient stupas and ruins.
  • Overnight stay in Varanasi.

• After a morning at leisure, transfer to the airport for your flight back to Delhi.
  • Upon arrival, visit the Lotus Temple, known for its stunning flower-like design and peaceful atmosphere.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After breakfast, check out of your hotel and proceed to the international airport for your onward journey.
  • Experience the spiritual heritage of North India with our Temple Tour Package. Book now for an enriching journey.

Name: North India – Temple Tour
Title: North India Temple Tour Package - Eaze Tours
Description: Plan your North India temple tour package with Eaze Tours. Explore iconic temples, cultural landmarks, and spiritual destinations. Book your journey today!
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather and festive occasions.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, spiritual seekers, and cultural enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, a hat for sun protection, and essentials like sunscreen and a camera.
  • Customize the tour as per your preferences and travel pace.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.

• Comfortable accommodation at hotels and guesthouses
  • Daily breakfast and meals as per itinerary
  • Private transport for sightseeing and transfers
  • Guided tours of temples and historical sites
  • Entry fees to temples and monuments
  • Professional guides with expertise in temple history and culture
  • Assistance with Darshan and Pooja rituals
Overview: Embark on a spiritual journey through the heart of North India with our North India Temple Tour Package. Explore the historic and sacred temples, each with its unique significance and rich cultural heritage. This tour takes you through vibrant cities and ancient sites, offering a deep connection to India’s religious diversity, traditions, and spirituality. From the holy ghats of Varanasi to the divine temples of Amritsar, this package promises a fulfilling and peaceful experience.

description.S: • Upon arrival, you will be greeted and assisted at the airport, followed by a transfer to your hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a sightseeing tour of both Old and New Delhi.
  • In Old Delhi, visit the iconic Red Fort, Jama Masjid (one of the largest mosques in India), Raj Ghat (the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi), and take a walking tour through Chandni Chowk, the bustling silver street.
  • In New Delhi, visit Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, Humayun’s Tomb (an Indo-Persian architectural marvel and precursor to the Taj Mahal), India Gate (a war memorial), and drive past the President’s House, Parliament House, Government Secretariat buildings, and Connaught Place, the vibrant shopping hub of New Delhi.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, transfer to the airport for a flight to Bhubaneswar.
  • Upon arrival, embark on a half-day sightseeing tour, including the Lingaraj Temple (11th-13th century), Rajarani Temple, Mukteswar Temple, Dhauli Peace Pagoda, and the ancient Jain monk caves at Khandagiri and Udayagiri.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Enjoy breakfast and take an excursion to the historical site of Ratnagiri.
  • Return to Bhubaneswar for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, depart for Baliguda.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel for an overnight stay.

• After breakfast, visit various villages and explore the Desai Kondh tribal culture.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Following breakfast, journey to Belghar, where you'll visit Huttiya Kondha Tribal villages and the weekly market at Kotagarh.
  • Enjoy lunch en route.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel in Rayagada.

• Drive to Onukudelli to visit the weekly market of the Bonda and Gadaba tribes.
  • Explore some Gadaba villages before continuing your journey to Jeypore for an overnight stay.

• Visit the Paraja tribe at the largest market in Kundli.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Today, explore the Dhuruba tribe in the Laxmipur and Bonda regions.
  • Visit the Jagannath Temple and the Tribal Museum at Koraput.
  • The Jagannath Temple here is unique in that non-Hindus are allowed inside, and its activities resemble those of the Puri temple.
  • Enjoy lunch along the way and return to Rayagada for an overnight stay.

• Drive to Chilika, visiting the Taptapani hot springs on the way.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Puri.
  • Spend the evening relaxing at the beach.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Enjoy a full-day city tour of Puri, visiting the Jagannath Temple and other important temples.
  • You will also visit Konark to see the famous Sun Temple.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Puri to Bhubaneswar and Departure to Delhi

description.S: • After breakfast, transfer to Bhubaneswar airport to catch your flight to Delhi for your onward journey.

Name: Tour to Orissa
Title: Orissa Tour Package India: Explore Ancient Temples
Description: Explore the rich culture and heritage with our Orissa tour package in India. Visit temples, wildlife sanctuaries, & scenic landscapes on a memorable journey.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, when the weather is pleasant for sightseeing.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, culture lovers, and nature enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, and a camera for scenic views.
  • Customize your itinerary based on personal interests and travel preferences.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in comfortable hotels and resorts
  • Daily breakfast and meals as per itinerary
  • Private transportation for all sightseeing and transfers
  • Guided tours to temples, beaches, and cultural sites
  • Entry fees to monuments and temples
  • Assistance with Darshan and local rituals
  • Professional tour guides with knowledge of Orissa’s heritage
Overview: Explore the rich cultural heritage, ancient temples, and stunning landscapes of Orissa with our Orissa Tour Package. Known for its classical dance, art, and pristine beaches, Orissa offers a unique blend of tradition and natural beauty. Visit sacred temples, serene beaches, and UNESCO World Heritage sites, including the iconic Sun Temple of Konark and the Jagannath Temple of Puri. This tour promises an unforgettable experience for history lovers, spiritual seekers, and nature enthusiasts.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in Bhubaneswar, you will be assisted and transferred to your hotel.
  • Relax for the rest of the day at the hotel.
  • Bhubaneswar, meaning 'The Lord of the Universe,' is the modern capital of Odisha and was once the capital of the Kalinga Empire. The region holds historical significance dating back to the 7th century, when the Kalinga kings ruled.
  • Overnight in Bhubaneswar.

• In the morning, enjoy a guided city tour of Bhubaneswar.
  • The city is known for its many temples, including the Brahmeswar and Parasurameswara temples from the 7th century, famous for their intricate lattice windows.
  • The 10th-century Mukteswar Temple is known for its beautiful toranas (arches), and the 11th-century Rajarani Temple features exquisite carvings.
  • The Lingaraj Temple, also from the 11th century, is the finest example of Kalinga architecture, though non-Hindus can only view it from the outside.
  • The afternoon is free for independent activities.
  • Overnight in Bhubaneswar.

• Embark on a full-day guided excursion to Puri and Konark. Puri (62 km from Bhubaneswar) is one of India’s four sacred Dhams and the residence of Lord Jagannath. Situated on the Bay of Bengal, Puri has long been a pilgrimage center, known for its grand Rath Yatra procession.
  • Next, visit the Sun Temple at Konark, also known as the Black Pagoda. This 13th-century temple is designed as a colossal chariot with seven horses and 24 wheels, representing the passage of time. The temple is adorned with thousands of intricate carvings depicting deities, celestial beings, dancers, and animals.
  • Overnight stay in Bhubaneswar.

• Drive to Baliguda, passing through scenic rural landscapes and typical Oriya villages. Balliguda, located in the Phulbani district, marks the entry point to Odisha’s tribal highlands.
  • The drive takes you through the beautiful Sal forests and mountainous roads.
  • Arrive in Balliguda by evening and check-in at your hotel.
  • Overnight stay at a hotel in Balliguda.

• In the morning, drive to Rayagada, stopping along the way to visit villages of the Kutia Kondh tribe, known for their unique traditions, including their historic practice of human sacrifice.
  • This community lives in the mountains and forests and is known for its friendliness.
  • Enjoy a trek through the region if desired.
  • Overnight stay in Rayagada.

• Spend the day exploring the weekly market at Kotagarh and visit the villages of the Desia Kondh and Dongaria Kondh tribes.
  • Overnight stay in Rayagada.

• In the morning, drive to Jeypore, stopping at Chatikona to witness the colorful weekly market of the Dongria tribe.
  • You’ll also visit the Jharia Paroja village. The tribes here, from the Niyamgiri hill range, bring their goods like fruits and animals to the market, providing a unique cultural experience.
  • Continue your drive to Jeypore for an overnight stay.

• Visit Onkadelli in the morning to experience the weekly market of the Bonda tribe.
  • In the afternoon, explore the villages of the Gadaba tribe.
  • Overnight stay in Jeypore.

• Travel to Kundli, 65 km from Jeypore, to visit the largest tribal market in the region, where you’ll see the vibrant market of the Sanaparoja and Mali tribes.
  • Next, head to Nandpur to visit the villages of the Sanaparoja tribe, with opportunities for small treks to villages like Khilus, Saana Padar, and Bda Padar.
  • You can also visit the Gupteshwar caves, home to the Dhuruba tribe, located 70 km from Jeypore.
  • Explore the villages of Ramanguda, Dogariguda, Silpader, and Talur.
  • In the evening, head back to Jeypore for overnight stay.

• Drive to Jagdalpur, stopping along the way to explore the terracotta work and dyeing techniques in Kotapadu village.
  • Upon arrival in Jagdalpur, check in at your hotel.
  • Overnight stay in Jagdalpur.

• Drive to Chitrakut and visit the villages of the Muria tribe and their weekly market.
  • In the afternoon, explore local villages and the stunning Chitrakot Waterfalls, also known as the 'Niagara of India'. This horseshoe-shaped waterfall, 100 feet high, is a must-see, especially during the monsoon season.
  • Overnight stay in Chitrakoot.

• Drive to Kailash Cave in the Kanger Valley, and visit the Bhadra tribal village.
  • Overnight stay in Chitrakoot.

• Drive to Narayanpur in the morning to view the distinctive tribal artwork of the Maria tribe.
  • Visit Kondagaon to see wooden crafts, followed by a tribal dance performance in the evening.
  • Overnight stay in Narayanpur.

• Travel to Raipur in the morning, stopping to visit the villages of the Maria tribe in the Gadbental area.
  • Overnight stay in Raipur.
• Transfer to the airport for your onward flight.

Name: Orissa – Chattisgarh Program
Title: Orissa Chattisgarh Tour Package India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore Orissa and Chhattisgarh with our tailored tour packages. Experience rich culture, stunning landscapes, and unique traditions in India.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, for pleasant weather and smooth travel conditions.
  • Ideal For: History buffs, culture enthusiasts, spiritual seekers, and nature lovers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, walking shoes, sunscreen, and a camera to capture the beauty.
  • Customizable itineraries available based on your preferences.

  • Daily breakfast and meals as per the itinerary
  • Private transportation for all transfers and sightseeing
  • Guided tours of historical, cultural, and religious sites
  • Entry fees to monuments, temples, and parks
  • Professional guides with in-depth knowledge of local history and culture
  • Assistance with rituals and temple darshan
Overview: Embark on a captivating journey through the culturally rich states of Orissa and Chhattisgarh. This Orissa & Chhattisgarh Tour Package takes you through ancient temples, stunning tribal villages, scenic landscapes, and vibrant festivals. From the sacred temples of Puri and Bhubaneswar in Orissa to the tribal culture and wildlife sanctuaries in Chhattisgarh, this tour is perfect for those seeking a deep dive into India’s traditional and spiritual heritage.

name.S: Arrive in Delhi (Check-in at hotel after 2:00 PM)

description.S:
• Upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport, you will be greeted by our representative who will assist you with your transfer to the hotel.
  • Delhi, the capital of India, is a city full of contrasts, where history and modernity coexist.
  • Over centuries, various dynasties have ruled this fascinating city, leaving behind architectural marvels.
  • Situated along the River Yamuna, Delhi has witnessed the rise and fall of numerous civilizations over the last 5,000 years.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After breakfast at the hotel, embark on a tour of Old Delhi. Drive past the historic Red Fort, and nearby, visit the Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, built by Shah Jahan.
  • Experience a rickshaw ride through the vibrant markets of Chandni Chowk, located near both the Fort and the Mosque.
  • Visit Raj Ghat, the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. In the afternoon, explore New Delhi, starting with Qutub Minar, a 12th-century tower built by Qutbuddin Aibak, and the famous Iron Pillar.
  • You’ll also drive by India Gate, a war memorial, and pass the Presidential Residence (Rashtrapati Bhawan) along with Parliament House.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.

• After a leisurely breakfast, you have free time until it’s time to head to the railway station for your train journey to Sawai Madhopur.
  • Train details: Kota Janshatabdi / 12060, Departure: 13:20 hrs, Arrival: 18:02 hrs, Class: A/C Chair Car.
  • Upon arrival in Sawai Madhopur, you will be met by our representative and transferred to Ranthambore.
  • This national park, covering 400 sq km, is known for its tigers and rich wildlife, including gazelles, leopards, sambars, and wild bulls. The area is dotted with historical ruins that enhance its enchanting landscape.
  • Check in at the hotel for the night.

• Today, enjoy both a morning and evening game drive in Ranthambore National Park, known for its impressive tiger sightings.
  • Overnight stay in Ranthambore.

name.S: Ranthambore to Fatehpur Sikri and Agra (267 km, 5-6 hours)

description.S:
• This morning, you’ll transfer to Agra with a visit to Fatehpur Sikri en route.
  • This 16th-century city, built by Emperor Akbar, is a collection of palaces, forts, and mosques made of sandstone, and was abandoned due to a water shortage.
  • Explore the Tomb of Sheikh Salim Chisti, Akbar's spiritual advisor. Afterward, continue to Agra, the home of the Taj Mahal.
  • Agra, once the Mughal capital, boasts splendid architecture and skilled craftsmanship.
  • Overnight in Agra.

name.S: Agra and Overnight Train to Katni

description.S:
• Visit the Taj Mahal in the morning, the iconic symbol of love built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Afterward, explore Agra Fort, an imposing structure built by three successive Mughal emperors, and the tomb of Itimad-Ud-Daulah, also known as the 'Baby Taj.'
  • In the evening, transfer to the train station for your overnight journey to Katni.
  • Train details: Mahakoshal Express / 12190, Departure: 19:30 hrs, Arrival: 09:35 hrs (next day), Class: 2-Tier AC Sleeper.

name.S: Katni to Bandhavgarh (100 km, approx. 3 hours)

description.S:
• Arrive at Katni and transfer to Bandhavgarh.
  • This park, one of India’s densest tiger reserves, is known for its rich tiger sightings. The park is small, with valleys and streams flowing into the River Son.
  • It is also famous for its hilltop views and historical significance, with legends associating it with the god Shiva.
  • Enjoy an afternoon safari.
  • Overnight stay in Bandhavgarh.

• Today, enjoy both morning and evening safaris in Bandhavgarh National Park.
  • The park is home to many wildlife species, including tigers.
  • Overnight stay in Bandhavgarh.

name.S: Bandhavgarh to Kanha (250 km, approx. 6 hours)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Kanha National Park.
  • This 940-sq-km reserve is one of the finest tiger habitats in India, known for its diverse landscapes, including hills, valleys, and meadows.
  • Enjoy an afternoon safari in the park.
  • Overnight stay in Kanha.

• Today, you’ll have the chance to enjoy both a morning and an afternoon safari in Kanha, home to tigers, leopards, and other wildlife.
  • Overnight stay in Kanha.

name.S: Kanha to Nagpur (262 km, approx. 6 hours) and Return to Delhi

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Nagpur and fly to Delhi.
  • Flight details: Indigo 6E-136, Departure: 18:00 hrs, Arrival: 19:40 hrs. On arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred to your hotel.
  • Overnight stay in Delhi.
• After breakfast, you will be transferred to the international airport for your onward journey.

Name: In Search of Tigers
Title: Book Luxury Tiger Safari Tours in India - Eaze Tours
Description: Experience the thrill of a Tiger Safari in India with Eaze Tours. Explore wildlife sanctuaries and get up close with majestic tigers in their natural habitat. Book Now!
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, as the weather is pleasant, and wildlife sightings are more frequent.
  • Ideal For: Wildlife enthusiasts, photographers, and nature lovers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, binoculars, camera, sunscreen, and a hat for sun protection.
  • Fitness Level: Moderate, as some safaris may require short treks or jeep rides through rugged terrain.
Whats_excluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in comfortable jungle resorts and hotels
  • Daily meals (as per itinerary), including local and vegetarian options
  • Private or shared safari jeep rides with expert wildlife guides
  • Entry fees to national parks and reserves
  • Travel insurance for the duration of the safari
  • Professional safari guides with knowledge of wildlife and tigers
  • Private transport for transfers to and from the safari destinations
Overview: Embark on an exciting Tiger Safari in India, where you can witness the majestic Bengal tigers in their natural habitat. India is home to several world-renowned tiger reserves and national parks, including Jim Corbett, Ranthambore, Bandhavgarh, and Kaziranga. This adventure is perfect for wildlife enthusiasts, photographers, and nature lovers, offering a rare opportunity to spot tigers along with a variety of other wildlife species in lush forests and pristine environments.

description.S: • Upon arrival at Mumbai, you will be met by our representative who will assist you with your transfer to the hotel.

name.S: Baroda to Ahmedabad and Onwards to Utellia

description.S:
• After breakfast at the hotel, transfer to the airport for your flight to Baroda (Flight: 9W-349, 10:15 – 11:05 hrs).
  • Upon arrival in Baroda, you will be transferred to your hotel.
  • Later, take a trip to Chhota Udaipur to meet the Rathwa tribes, considered to be one of the most primitive tribal communities of Gujarat.
  • Enjoy an early lunch and then proceed by jeep to visit tribal villages like Kol, Kharakwada, Timla, and Devhat.
  • In the evening, return to Baroda.

name.S: Baroda to Ahmedabad and Onwards to Utellia

description.S:
• After breakfast, transfer to the airport for a flight to Ahmedabad.
  • Upon arrival, drive to Utellia (78 km, approx. 1.5 hours), a quaint feudal village known for its medieval palace.
  • Check-in at the hotel and enjoy the evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay in Utellia.

• Today, visit the Bharwad tribal village.
  • The Bharwad people, traditionally shepherds and cattle herders, are known for their love of color, particularly blue, green, and white, which they use to paint their homes.
  • Visit the homes of these vibrant tribes and get a glimpse into their everyday life.
  • Some Bharwads are now engaged in diamond cutting and polishing, and you’ll have the opportunity to observe this fascinating process.
  • Also visit a local camel-breeding farm, known for producing high-quality camels.
  • Overnight stay in Utellia.

name.S: Utellia to Balaram (120 km, approx. 2 hours)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Balaram, a picturesque holy town nestled amidst lush green forests.
  • On the way, visit the famous Calico Museum, Adalaj Stepwell (built in 1499), and the Modhera Sun Temple, which dates back to 1026 AD and is often compared to the Konark Temple in Orissa.
  • Continue your drive to Balaram and check-in at the Balaram Palace Resort, a renowned heritage resort in Gujarat.
  • Overnight stay at Balaram Palace Resort.

name.S: Balaram Excursion to the Gowala and Garasia Tribal Regions

description.S:
• Visit the Gowala and Garasia tribes, located in the hills bordering Gujarat and Rajasthan.
  • The Gowalas are more settled, while the Garacia are nomadic, with distinct cultural traditions.
  • Women in these tribes dress differently, with Garacia women wearing less ornate attire compared to the Gowala women.
  • Explore these tribes’ unique cultures, and enjoy a private tribal dance performance in the evening.
  • Overnight stay in Balaram.

name.S: Balaram to Patan and Little Rann of Kutch

description.S:
• Today, drive to Patan, once the capital of medieval Gujarat, known for its Hindu and Jain architecture.
  • Visit the 11th-century Rani-ki-Vav stepwell and meet one of the three families of Patola weavers, known for their intricate double ikkat weaving technique.
  • Afterward, continue your journey to the Little Rann of Kutch and check-in at the Desert Courser Camp.
  • Overnight stay at Desert Courser Camp.

• Explore the Little Rann of Kutch, a vast salt flat and marshy terrain home to the endangered Asiatic Wild Ass.
  • The region is also home to the nomadic Rabari and settled Banjara tribes.
  • Spend the day exploring the wildlife and tribal culture of the area.
  • Overnight stay at Desert Courser Camp.

name.S: Little Rann of Kutch to Bhuj

description.S:
• Today, embark on a scenic drive to Bhuj, the capital of the Kutch region.
  • Along the way, if you are lucky, you might encounter migrating Rabari tribes.
  • Check-in at your hotel in Bhuj for a four-night stay, where you will explore the diverse and colorful tribal culture of the region.
  • Overnight stay in Bhuj.

name.S: Bhuj – Exploring the Tribes of Kutch

description.S:
• The Rann of Kutch is home to many unique and vibrant tribes such as the Megwar, Samma, Jat, Mutwa, Ahir, and Rabari.
  • Over the next few days, you will visit different tribal villages to witness their fascinating lifestyles and rich traditions.
  • Also, explore Bhuj, which was severely affected by the 2001 earthquake.
  • Visit the Old City, the Aina Mahal (Old Palace), the Prag Mahal (New Palace), and the Bharatiya Folk Museum, which showcases tribal life.
  • Meet an artist who still practices the ancient Rogan painting technique.
  • Overnight stay in Bhuj.

• Take another excursion to explore more tribal regions of Little Rann of Kutch, continuing your discovery of local cultures and traditions.
  • Overnight stay in Bhuj.

• Another day of excursions to different tribal areas, where you’ll get further insight into the region's unique lifestyle and traditions.
  • Overnight stay in Bhuj.

• Enjoy a relaxed morning at leisure before transferring to Bhuj airport for your flight to Mumbai.
  • Upon arrival in Mumbai, you will be met and transferred to your hotel.
  • Overnight stay in Mumbai.
• After breakfast, you will be transferred to the international airport or railway station for your onward journey, taking with you beautiful memories of your Gujarat Tribal Tour.

  • Ideal For: Cultural enthusiasts, history lovers, adventure seekers, and those fascinated by tribal lifestyles.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing and footwear, a camera to capture the vibrant scenes, and a journal for keeping notes of your experiences.
  • Customizable Itinerary: Tailor the tour to explore specific tribal communities or regions of Gujarat based on your interests.
Whats_excluded:

  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.

Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in traditional homestays or eco-friendly resorts.
  • All meals (traditional and authentic tribal cuisine).
  • Private transportation for transfers and sightseeing.
  • Guided tours to tribal villages and cultural sites.
  • Entry fees to tribal museums and sanctuaries.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in Chennai, you will be met and transferred to your hotel.
  • In the afternoon, embark on a sightseeing tour to explore the cultural richness of South India.
  • Chennai, originally a British settlement, still retains a blend of traditional lifestyle and colonial charm.
  • Visit key sites like the Kapaleeswarar Temple, a stunning example of Dravidian architecture dating back to 1250 AD, and the Parthasarathy Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
  • Explore Fort St. George, built in 1640 AD, the first British bastion in India, and St. Thomas Mount, the site of the martyrdom of St. Thomas in 72 AD.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Kanchipuram, one of India’s seven sacred cities.
  • Historically, it served as the capital of the Pallavas and later the Cholas and the Vijayanagar Rayas.
  • Visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, known for its towering 57-meter Rajagopuram, and the Kamakshi Amman Temple, one of the three holy sites dedicated to Shakti worship in India.
  • Later, drive to Mamallapuram, and upon arrival, check into the hotel. The rest of the day is free for leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a sightseeing tour of Mamallapuram.
  • Visit the Shore Temple, one of the oldest in India, dedicated to both Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu.
  • Explore the Five Rathas, monolithic temples carved from a single rock, and Arjuna's Penance, the world’s largest bas-relief. This 27m x 9m relief showcases an array of divine figures and creatures.
  • The rest of the day is free for leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Pondicherry. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, enjoy a sightseeing tour of this former French colony.
  • Visit Aurobindo Ashram, a center for spiritual development and the synthesis of yoga and modern science.
  • Also, visit Auroville, a universal township founded by Shree Aurobindo and The Mother in 1926 to promote peaceful living and spiritual growth.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out and drive to Thanjavur.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel, followed by a sightseeing tour. Known as the Rice Bowl of Tamil Nadu, Thanjavur is home to several historic temples.
  • Visit the Brihadeeswara Temple, an architectural marvel of the Chola dynasty, famous for its towering central dome and massive monolithic stone slab.
  • Also, explore the Thanjavur Palace and Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses over 30,000 manuscripts.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out and drive to Tiruchirapalli.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel, followed by a sightseeing tour.
  • Visit the Rock Fort, a massive rock with a temple perched atop, offering panoramic views of the city.
  • Explore the Rock Fort Temple and Srirangam, an island town known for the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, one of the largest Vaishnavite temples in South India.
  • The temple complex is surrounded by seven walls and features 21 towering gopurams.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Madurai.
  • On arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the magnificent Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, famous for its towering gopurams and intricate carvings.
  • Also, explore the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, an Indo-Saracenic architectural wonder built in the 17th century.
  • Visit Vandiyur Mariamman Tank, a large temple tank with a mandapam in the center.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

Check-out of the hotel and transfer to the airport in time to board flight for Chennai. Arrive Chennai and connect flight for Bangalore. Assistance on arrival and transfer to hotel. Later proceed for sightseeing tour of Bangalore, one of the most pleasant cities of India takes in the central area which is studded with beautifully laId out parks, gardens, wIde tree-lined avenues, imposing buildings and lively bazaars. Bangalore is famous for the VIdhan Soudha which is one of the India’s most spectacular buildings, built in granite in the neo-DravIdian style of architecture. The Cubban Park is a beautifully landscaped; full of flowering trees and covers the park is the lung of the city an area of 120 hectares. The park is the lung of the city and was laId out in 1864. Some of the other attractions in Bangalore include the Lalbagh Gardens, the Tipu Sultan’s Palace and the Bull Temple, one of the Bangalore’s oldest temples.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Mysore, with a stop at Srirangapatna, the summer palace of Tipu Sultan.
  • Explore the island fortress, which is surrounded by the river Cauvery.
  • Upon arrival in Mysore, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, visit the Maharaja’s Palace, a stunning example of Indo-Saracenic architecture.
  • Explore the Jaganmohan Palace, now an art gallery, and the Brindavan Gardens, famous for its colorful lights and dancing fountains.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Hassan.
  • En-route, visit Shravanabelagola, a small village known for its massive Jain statue of Gomateshwara.
  • Upon arrival in Hassan, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, visit the historic sites of Belur and Halebid.
  • Belur is famous for the Chennakesava Temple, known for its intricate carvings.
  • Halebid was the ancient capital of the Hoysala Empire and is home to the Hoysaleswara Temple.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

Overview: Experience the grandeur of India’s royal past with our Royal Delhi, Jaipur & Agra Tour Package. This package takes you through three of the most iconic cities in India – Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra. Explore majestic forts, palaces, and architectural marvels, and immerse yourself in the rich culture and history of India’s royal heritage. From the bustling streets of Delhi to the romantic Taj Mahal in Agra and the royal palaces of Jaipur, this tour offers an unforgettable experience of India's regal legacy.

description.S: • Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel.

• In the morning, embark on a tour of Old Delhi, a city rich in history and culture.
  • Your first stop is the Red Fort, built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan when he moved his capital from Agra.
  • Next, visit Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque.
  • Continue to Rajghat, the memorial for Mahatma Gandhi.
  • In the afternoon, explore New Delhi, including a visit to Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, constructed in 1191 AD.
  • You will also visit the serene Chhatarpur Temple, followed by a stop at Humayun’s Tomb, which is believed to have inspired the Taj Mahal.
  • The Bahai Temple, also known as the Lotus Temple, will be your final stop.
  • It is open to all faiths and serves as a place for peace and meditation.
  • The evening is free for leisure.
  • Stay overnight at the hotel.

• In the morning, begin your journey to Jaipur. Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, take a sightseeing tour of Jaipur.
  • Visit the City Palace, which houses several palaces and museums showcasing collections from the princely era.
  • Explore the Jantar Mantar, an outdoor observatory built in 1726 by King Jai Singh, which features instruments of remarkable precision.
  • End the tour with a visit to Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, famous for its façade of windows and latticed screens.

• In the morning, take an excursion to Amber Fort, located on a hill.

  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After an early breakfast, depart for Agra, stopping en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, the former capital of Emperor Akbar, abandoned due to water shortages.
  • Upon reaching Agra, check-in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the Taj Mahal, a stunning symbol of eternal love, built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • You will also visit Agra Fort, where you can enjoy breathtaking views of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower across the Yamuna River.

• After breakfast, transfer to the railway station for your train journey to Jhansi.
  • Upon arrival, drive to Khajuraho and check in at the hotel.
